text: While the neighborhood has changed significantly over the last thirty years, (not for the better)  La Pinata hasn't changed a bit. The food is still wonderful and the margaritas are too. Their salsa is my favorite in the Valley though I like Carlo's O'Brien's chips better. I don't care how authentic Mexican food is, I want the food of my childhood when I return to Phoenix and La Pinata is it. The spinach queso dip is really good and I always get a machaca chimichanga because theirs are outstanding. Wish I got to Phoenix more often....
Love the new location.  Has a modern hip vibe, but yet still retained their authentic Mexican food.  Great combination!
This place is the only place for Mexican food within 2432 miles. Tamales, red chili and the Margs are the best.

Love this place! Everything I've had has been great. Their Mexican pizza w machaca beef is my favorite thing on whole menu! Great food, service, and prices. This place has a vintage phoenix Mexican restaurant vibe....very chill and inviting. Been going there since I was little and La Pinata will always be my go-to for easy, straight forward, sonoran Mexican food.

The food we ordered was really good. It's not super authentic or anything but definitely a lot better than other Mexican-American places in Phoenix. Our server, Matt, was super polite and attentive. 

Side note: Our early dinner entertainment was provided by the table behind us. The woman was explaining, (practically yelling) to the man that she was with, that she steals from the adult bookstore that she works for (and that they should expect her to) because she isn't paid well enough. Oh, okay. Then she offered to steal some porn for him and asked his preference. After first choosing heavier white ladies, he changed his mind to "blue, green, whatever..." After they left, people on the other side of us started talking about cysts and boils! Then someone did the whole horn nose blow routine. It blows my mind that people still (in 2013!) don't realize that nose-blowing is meant for the restroom while in a restaurant. How many comedians have to talk about it publicly before it reaches everyone? Anyhow, I'm not holding any of this stuff against the restaurant, I just felt compelled to share.

Dropped by for Lunch today at 2:15 pm.  Place was largely empty with  plenty of staff around. It took 20 mins  for my food and  later nearly 20 mins to receive check after my meal!. I asked to see dessert  menu,which was ignored twice by server.So no flan today !  Bottom line:Food was marginally OK ,Service was bad and this surprisingly  from an iconic  restaurant with 45 years in this  business . Emphasis evidently  is on bar offerings "Casa Margarita'  they call it.Try El Bravo  or Las Glorias or Los Compadres if you are after good Mexican fare in  North Central Phoenix.   FYI :I've lived in this neighborhood for 46 years so I believe  i know  my Mexican food.  I voiced my dissatisfaction to the Manager.No plans to return.

Nice chill spot , customer service is good, looks nice in there, has a modern Mexican twist with a lil razzle dazzle the food was OKAY could be better , the area is nice , the location is perfect  good parking

I am a long time, faithful friend of La Pinatas.  La Pinata has been a source of comfort through the good times and bad times in my life.  I have rabidly encourage friend and foe alike to make the venture to the dump that is 19th Avenue and Osborn and brave the wild flora and fauna that is the neighborhood to get the La Pinata.  Why?  The food is the BEST!  

I have never received bad service.  I have been eating here for 14 years (Holy cow! I can't believe it's been THAT long!) now and I have never eaten a bad meal here.  My old standby:  Chicken Yucatan with Jalapeno cream cheese.  The yucatan is basically a chimichanga, smothered with ranchero sauce and queso con espinaca.  De-freaking-licious.  Served with beans and rice.  Your choice of sour cream or jalapeno cream cheese.  Get the cream cheese.  You will never regret it.  I have never been a fan of their chips and salsa but frankly, I am there for the plate of gluttony!

Outstanding food!  I had what equated to the sampler of everything when I was there.  Since I live in Ohio, it may be a few months before I fly out again to see family.  I will be sure to stop in when I arrive again.  I've been talking about my experience in Phoenix and this restaurant ever since I returned home.

I love this place. I have the chicken tacos, chicken taco salad and the machaca beef taco salad. All very good. Love the chips and salsa. Love the service. Went there the other nite told our waiter that the last time we came my son ordered the Carne Asada Burro dinner did not get beans and rice but got charged for it. My son ordered it that nite again and the waiter only charged us for the burro to make up for it. Really cool. My other son really likes the Chimi. My boyfriend loves the cheeseburger not a great Mexican fan is he but he goes with us for the burger. I will continue to go here.

Yum. Try the steak fajitas. 
They charge for any extras. Our fajitas came out with hardly any peppers and onions at all. I asked if we could have some more, and when the check came I was charged $4 for a side of grilled onions (didn't even have any peppers) So I felt a little ripped off, but I still love the steak fajitas and I also love the rice and beans. I will be back and nextime not order any extras to be safe.

Food is ok...however the well margarita is 6.25 which will cost more if you ask for it frozen.....BTW it's premixed so dont bother.   tried to voice my concern to owner who didnt care or wish to listen.

Love the new location even though I am nostalgic for the old.  Same great food they have had since the 70's(the best green corn tamales I've ever found in a restaurant.)  Cheese crisps are actually crisp!!!  

Love that the new location has outdoor seating which the old one lacked.  The restrooms are a great improvement too.  

Their enchilada and sauce is closer to the great stuff we got back in the 60's and 70's than on most cheese enchiladas in restaurants in recent decades (deep red/rust sauce, tasty cheese with tiny chopped onion, wrapped in good corn tortillas, topped with chopped black olives and white crumbled cheese)....not the same, but closer than most restaurants.  Shredded beef tacos are always good.  Salsa is good and they can bring algo mas picante.  My husband likes their machaca dinner and rarely strays from it.


We will be able to go more often now that they are way closer to our home.

My favorite chimichanga at a sit-down restaurant.

Many years ago I used to hit up La Pinata about once a week in its old location. It's one of the best casual Mexican restaurants I've ever been to. I recently got to sneak in before the lunch rush at their new location. It used to be Mary Coyle ice cream *sad face*.

The chimichanga is big. It's lightly crisped all around in deep fried goodness. The beef has an option of either machaca (really just shredded beef, no eggs in it) or ground beef. I prefer the machaca - tons of seasoned shredded meat that has never been dry or burned. Lots of red sauce but not quite drowned in it and a bit of cheese, lettuce, chopped tomato. The lunch special I had comes with rice, which was fluffy and good, and beans, which were very creamy topped with a bit of 2 different cheeses.

I've tried their tacos (good), tamales (average), enchiladas (good), "There's a taco in my burro!" burro (interesting but okay), albondigas soup (very good), chicken tortilla soup (okay, was always salty), Pinata Chimi (very good), machadilla (great), fajitas (average)...almost half their menu but at their old location. I'll have to come back with an update and try some of these again.

Their complementary chips are above average. The salsa is very chunky and tasty. The hot sauce is really good - hot in heat and lots of chili flavor.

The new interior is all windows towards the street with a front patio that can seat quite a few. Plenty of space between tables and booths. The bar is off to the side with about a dozen seats. They still have a couple of pinatas a the entrance but not nearly as many as before. It's nice. Parking could be an issue - they have about 20 spaces and when I left around noon, not a single spot was open.

Some things don't need to change and La Pinata is one of them. So happy the food is the same after all these years.  Great flavors- starting with the salsa (both the chunky served with the chips and the special "red sauce" from the back) and chips to the iced tea- strong real brewed flavor. Couldn't decide what to order so I got the green corn tamale with green sauce and the shredded beef n bean tostada with guacamole.  The tamale was flavorful and sweet- it went well with the green sauce. The sauce was nicely rich which chunks of onions and green chile- enough substance to eat alone with the melted cheese on top. The shredded beef of the tostada was very flavorful, the guacamole had the right balance of avocado and garlic. Was very ful. My lunch date ordered the Taco in my Burrito, deep fried. He was pleased as well. The food at La Pinata is loaded with flavor, but not overpowered by spicey heat. If you like your Mexican Food really spicey, you'll have to ask for it here. What you'll find here is quality ingredients cooked with old family recipes that haven't changed much over the 30 years its been here. Definitely worth the trip!

My family has been eating here for 30 years however since they moved to their new smaller location the service has been terrible. Their attitude seems like they don't need your business and they sincerely act like it. I thought their move would hurt Sylvia's Mexican food which is directly across the street however with there don't care attitude Sylvia's is busier than ever.
Sorry to lose one of my favorite eating places but I won't spend my hard earned money for owners that take it for granted

I have been going to La Pianta for the last couple of years for lunch. I recently stopped by for dinner and it was awesome. You are always seated quickly with servers bringing chips/salsa and taking your drink order. The margaritas are great and the serving size of the steak fajitas was overstuffing me, lol..

This is the kind of Mexican food that I grew up eating at Karichimaka in Tucson. Delicious! My usual order is the red chile chimichanga, which is perfectly done. We also like the crispy cheese crisp with green chiles, and the free chips and salsa are great. 

I have to say that I've eaten at a lot of Mexican restaurants, and La Piñata and Karichimaka are the only ones that do justice to the red chile. Oregon, California, Colorado - all of these places seem to only offer New Mexican fare, which is fine but not truly authentic (to me). 

Their new location will be opening in the next month or so - they don't have an exact date. Come by and write a thank you note on the wall before they close the old location.

Good family friendly restaurant in central phoenix. This new location is very clean and feels somehow modern. The food is mostly good but Americanized a little. Tacos and burritos with lots of cheese (maybe too much) and the spicy level is quite low so the chips and salsas are kind of weak. Overall a good choice for Mexican food.
The rice was good , other than that the food was just average. Most notably the tortillas seem packaged. Overall disappointed

How can a place that's been around Phoenix for over 40 years be anything but Great!!  La Pinata's new location serves the best Mexican food anywhere in the valley.  Chips and salsa are made fresh daily, sometime more often.  The place is spotlessly clean, the service is top notch and the food is the best!  The chef, Peter, is usually wandering around kibitzing with the new patrons as well as his regulars.  He's a hoot!  Eat on the patio if the weather permits.  It's beautiful with a large fireplace and flickering lights all over.  The food portions are more than generous and you can tell the ingredients are top quality.  If you have room, try the "baked ice cream" or the sopapias with honey or chocolate.  Go to this place once and you can be sure it will become one of your regulars.

Went on a Friday. It was very crowded during happy hour. We were not offered a happy hour menu and had to wait 10 minutes before our server came by to offer drinks. We were just there for drinks and appetizers. The taquitos did not have much beef and the beef was extremely dry and not flavorful. I am not sure if the hype is because this is a new restaurant but I do not know how it stays so crowded.

Great local mexican restaurant that I always want to find when on business travel.  Not fancy, familyish feel to service, refried and rice style mexican place.   

Chips and flavorful/spicy salsa
I rate all mexican places on rellanos and carnitas.  Here the rellanos were the fluffy style and good.  It came with rice and beans which were very good.   Also ordered a la carte carnitas enchilada & it was great .  Also had their special margarita which was good.  

The one down side was the tortillas - esp the flour that came with the rellanos.  Side of corn I ordered where better, but still not even average.

All in all, for this style of low key mexican place, it was a solid 4.
__________________________________________________ 
Adding the following to all of my reviews:  
Way too many undeserved 5 star ratings on yelp.  Ratings should be a bell curve, with at least 50-60% of your ratings a 3.  5 should be another world special, not everyday good. 
___________________________________________________
I've been go here before I could walk. Love the food,  best chips and salsa around not to mention the margaritas! The people are great and especially the memories throughout the years.

Food just OK. Four of us went all ordered different meals. All just OK. Looking for something crave-worthy. Beer was cold and served in frosty mug. Had to ask for chip refill. We liked the ambience and location is perfect.
Great neighborhood restaurant and bar! Has a loyal following in the area for it's great bar staff and good food. The best part of course is their margaritas- so potent and tasty.

I love this place it is down the street from where I live and it is definitely old school Mexican food. I like it, The place has not been around for 39 years for nothing. I love the green chimi. I have now been there 3 times in two weeks. I love family owned businesses and hate going to chains. So this fills the bill perfectly

Not the best area of town, but you will be happy you made the trip.  We saw La Pinata advertised on the news and check them out Saturday.  We were greeted nicely at the door and taken to our table.  My server was phenomenal.  He was very high energy, SERVICE WITH SMILE, and attentive.  The food was AWESOME.  Our Pina Coladas were DELICIOUS. The chips and salsa was fresh.  The salsa was the best we ever had and the chips were served warm. We ordered two chicken tacos.  They were very flavorful and heaping full of meat.  We could not get over how everyone worked so nicely together.  Everyone appeared to be working very hard and everything was done with a smile.

My life long favorite restaurant. Though the meat varies, my usual is a burro (currently with machaca) enchilada style with a side of rice and I have not found another restaurant anywhere that makes this better. Also lots of love for the staff who have been like family.

I have been eating in this restaurant, since it opened. My grandmother, who is now 95, lives just up the street. Every time I'm in Phoenix, I eat at La Pinata. My husband always has a mixed bean and green chili burro enchilada style. I eat black beans, rice, guacamole, salsa, and fresh corn tortillas--they are wonderful at catering to my food allergies. Grandma eats spinach enchiladas. Mom is the only eclectic in the bunch and loves everything she tries. We love the extra spicy salsa, available upon request, as well as the house variety. The chips are the crispy extra thin variety that are sooo hard to resist. The service is impeccable and prices more than reasonable. The owners are friendly and of course recognize our family.
Really great food.  Went with the chimi - enchilada style.  Had to pass on the margaritas at lunch though, next time.

Love this restaurant and the new location! Everything from the decor to the food is fantastic. So happy that they have moved to a better location. I tried the soft tacos and guacamole. The chips and salsa are the best . I have also had the tamales which are delicious. Food is fresh and service is great. Will return soon. There is a great outdoor patio that I look forward to sitting at when the weather improves.

I has a bad experience here. I ordered a green tamale and a red tamale and beans and rice for take-out. When I arrived to pick up the order the bill was $19.70. The tamales were 4.95 each so that makes the beans and rice about 8+ dollars I guess.  After a frustrating conversation with the hostess about the price, I asked for the manager. Well it must have been his daughter because he was as dumb as she was. Out of frustration I paid that ridiculous price and left vowing never to return. I can see the order being written up incorrectly perhaps causing the bill to be high but that is why restaurant have managers, to fix problems and hopefully make sure others do not happen in the first place. Not at La Pinata!

our family favorite!  love this place.   The food is fabulous! great staff, 
very clean
Service wasn't bad at all, I actually like the decor and set up as well. The food just wasn't very good. I think eating authentic Mexican food in AZ may have spoiled my taste buds.

We've been here quite a few times because we live so close, but it wasn't until tonight that I finally got the order ready that really knocked my socks off.  

Beef machadilla and frozen blood orange margarita with salt.  Delish!!

I've had bad and good service..I ordered chicken green enchiladas to go, got home and they were red.I was very clear on saying please make sure it was green I went back and advised them.... The manager Lenard was there and didn't even apologize . They brought me the right one but didn't offer me a discount.
The manager stated, " oh sometimes the chef doesn't read if red or green." REALLY!!!  Customer satisfaction is not a priority for this restaurant

I always get the same thing at Mexican restaurants, a green chili burro enchilada style - boring, I know but tonight it was different. The meat was tender and choice cuts, the sauce smooth and spiced exactly like I like it. Beans and rice on the plate were also excellent. I am always looking for the "old school" Mexican food that I knew as a kid. Well this is the place! 

Me dinner companion had fajitas, a combo of steak and chicken, which were the best that I had tried anywhere  in the Valley. I was surprised because the old style restaurants usually don't do fajitas well, because they are not traditional.

We both had margaritas, very good, and also traditional. Meal topped off with ice cream with cinnamon, pastry, whipped cream - what could be bad about that?

Our service was outstanding by all employees, fast water, chips and salsa, drinks, and dinner. Friendly, professional staff added to an experience that I hope to repeat again and again.

By far the BEST Mexican food I have had here in the valley! Always a wait but always worth it! The staff is amazing! Starting from the little cute host that greats you at the door to the amazing food they place on your table! I live this place! Everyone needs to give it a taste! The red enchiladas are the BOMB! I kinda wish the queso was hot (spicy)

My sister wanted to meet for lunch one day last week, and told me to pick a place.  I was tired of all the usual spots, so after a quick search on Yelp, I came across La Pinata.

It is in an old strip mall on 19th Ave., but once you walk in, it is this funky, little retro Mexican restaurant with a cool vibe.  The menu is huge, with lots of the classic Sonoran style dishes us Arizonans love!

The chips and salsa were great; the chips were warm and the salsa was fresh and chunky with a touch of heat!  We tried the beans and they were really good, they didn't beat the beans at Los Compadres, but nonetheless, they were tasty.  We tried the cheese and the spinach enchiladas and both were really good, served piping hot!

We decided that we would definitely return to sample some more items on the vast menu!  They even had my all time favorite, the Mary Lou on the menu, and I just have to try that at some point!

So I was coming from Portland on a weekend trip and wanted some good Mexican food. Not nouveau, authentic, fancy, Mexican. Just honest to goodness tasty Mexican food. And a margarita or three. I did a lot of research and talked to many friends and finally settled on this place. Mostly it was the pictures of the beans and rice. I like my beans pinto and mashed. And I like rice that is not in the shape of an overturned bowl, meant to look fancy.  

So we get there on a Friday night around 7 and I'm expecting a wait because the parking lot if filled. We enter through the back and immediately the fresh smell of peppers hits us and I know we've made the right choice. We were immediately seated at a nice table by the bar and it was our good fortune to have Gabby as our server. She was very sweet and had a can do attitude!  She recommended several dishes and we decided to start with the Mary Lou Christmas tree. It's basically a fat quesadilla served with beef and red sauce on one side and pork and green sauce on the other.  It was phenomenal and a ton of food!  Seriously we would have been full from that, but my wife and I love enchiladas so I ordered the red/cheese with beans and rice. She ordered the chicken ala carte.  Again, very, very good.  Great salsa and chips too.

We wound up taking at least half the food home and had for lunch the next day.  

The margaritas were just ok, not fantastic but the service was A plus!

If you're looking for good, down home, tasty Mexican with great and friendly service with huge portions at a very reasonable cost. this is the place.  There, aren't you glad I did your research for you?

I have to say that this is my VERY favorite restaurant. We go there several times a week. We have been going there since the original La Piñata opened in 1970 and have never been disappointed. The food is wonderful ... service is attentive ... beautifully decorated. Take-out is now available and they are also doing Bar Specials, in addition to Happy Hour.  I love this place!!!!

PS  Try the frozen Blood Orange Margarita! My favorite!

Excellent food, chips and salsa.  My favorite is the Carnitas Burro, best I have every had.  I would give them 5 Stars but they are not offering take out.  Hard to go out and eat with the little ones.  I have been going to this place for over 20 years, new location is very nice.  UPDATE, they have take-out now, all is complete, we order from here almost every week, excellent food!
Love this place!  Their green corn tamale was delicious and I liked their chicken enchilada as well.  The decor is fun and the staff is super friendly.  Will definitely be back!

New place is a lot smaller, decorated upscale. So it would seem they would be more in that mode.  We would of liked if they put out small plates so you can put you salsa on the plate instead of all of us dipping from the same salsa bowl. They are tight on the chips, they come in a smaller bowl. When we asked for more chips the much older waitress seem annoyed. Also when you ask for an order to go why not put the container in a bag other restaurants do.  It was ok but I wouldn't drive out of my way to go back.Other Mexican restaurants are more customer friendly and food just as good or better.

Mexican cleansing, forget about fiber this place will clean your insides real good.  I didn't mind the over priced drinks or the low quality food but once I got the runs I knew I will never set foot on this place again.

I am very picky about my Mexican food. I grew up in a Spanish home and had the best cooking. This place is as close as it gets to home. Honestly you can not go wrong with anything you order from the fresh chips and salsa to the black bean burros.  My favorite the chili rellenos is great. If you want authentic food and really good service, this would be the place. The decor is a throw back to the 70's, but it is clean and comfortable. Staff is always friendly and welcoming. Their flan is delicious and two people can share one order of their fried ice cream.
The best machaca in town! We have tried several places in Phoenix and this one is a classic plus it offers great service and a relaxing atmosphere.

I never went to the old location but I am a fan of the new place!  I have been to dinner there twice now and have had good meals and service both times.  The blood orange margarita is delish!  Service is pretty quick and efficient and the wait time both times I went wasn't that long.

I cannot say enough kind words about the food at La Piñata. I share the same view as everyone else who has rang the praises about the amazing food. Now, I would like to take time to talk about the owners. I grew up at La Piñata in the 80's. I consider myself a close friend of the family. I remember Hope, the first lady aka founding mom of La Piñata. When I get to Heaven my hope is she will be willing to provide an endless supply of chips and salsa to me. I have known Roseanne, Romana and Peter since I was a little kid. I grew up with a kidney disease and eventually had a kidney transplant. I am an alumni in the Make A Wish Foundation in other words I was a Make A Wish kid. When Roseanne, Romana and Peter learned about Josh going on this Make A Wish trip to Canada they eventually threw a party closing down their restaurant to celebrate my life and raise money for Make A Wish. These people are some of the kindest people you will meet. I go there often and am always met with heart warming communication.

Who wants lunch? I came here with a coworker on a whim for lunch and wasn't disappointed. The tacos were nice for lunch. I didn't really like the selection, but it was pretty decent Mexican food. The service was good too. I recommend.

Still the best Mexican food in the State but parking, wait time & service is not what it used to be compared to the original location. Not to mention the lack of carryout now - I'm assuming due to the limited parking. If you're getting tired of waiting DON'T let them talk you into sitting at the community table! They say no reservations but apparently that doesn't apply to everyone. We saw a table for 5 + 2 high chairs in holding for over 30 min. When I asked about it they said that there was a party of 7 ahead of us but obviously they weren't there so clearly they do take reservations. Once we agreed to go to the community table then they divided the table up for two other parties of waiting customers . Go figure! I still won't eat Mexican food anywhere else but it's unfortunate that the customer service has declined so much.

The NEW La Piñata is a major disappointment !!

This is a great place if you like your food served tepid.

The WAS one of our favorite haunts ( 200+ visits over a number of years at the old location).

Since their move in October 2015, things have deteriorated.  The service is now mediocre and slow.  The noise level is profoundly louder.  The food is not served hot.  The lunch special menu variety is greatly reduced. 

Our LAST visit at the new location was today (our third attempt for a satisfactory experience at the new location):  We asked our waiter to make sure our order was served hot.  The food was barely warm.  We opted to take our food home to heat it.  When we asked for a container to take salsa home - the waiter informed us that the charge would be 75 cents.  We were insulted, especially since we had unsuccessfully asked our waiter three times for our first salsa refill.

In spite of all of this the restaurant seems busier - since the move. 

I am truly happy for the owners - but WE will not be returning.   Three strikes and you're out. 

There are too many better alternatives.  For example: Jordan's Mexican Food on 7th Street has vastly superior service, good food, and is pleasantly quiet.  It is only about 5 minutes away from the new (not improved) La Piñata.

The food is pretty good. I had chicken fajitas and I really enjoyed them although the chicken isn't sliced up, it's just a chicken breast. The portions are huge. Overall, I enjoyed my meal and the service was okay.
The staff is very friendly and the food was fantastic.  The shredded beef tacos, rice and beans were really good. I'll be back with the family for sure.

Been twice since they've opened and both times have liked the food. The staff has been great and attentive. No issues with owners/mgrs as stated in other reviews. Was disappointed when I read that take-out was not an option, so that' something to keep in mind. The food was very good and the prices are reasonable. Will return when looking to dine-in.

We went there on a Tuesday night for a family dinner. Granted we had 14 people, but the receptionist Was very rude. Don't think he wanted to be there that night. He told us it would be a very long wait. Yes they were busy but he was very rude and not helpful. We ended up leaving and went to Macayos. Got seated right away.  Had great service and the food was. Great. Unfortunately I missed out on la Pinatas great hot sauce.

Outdated decor and kind of musty smelling, but who cares.  I came for the food. Ordered the taco and enchilada lunch special. Surprisingly pricy for a basic lunch special. $9. 

The cheese enchilada was PERFECT! Gooey cheese and yummy sauce. However, the shredded beef taco was very disappointing. The meat itself was ok. A tad dry but I've had worse. The fried taco shell was extremely tough and chewy. Typically the shells are crispy. Not sure if I got one that was sitting for a while or perhaps they use extra thick corn tortillas? I only got halfway through the taco before I gave up. 

2 stars for the price and the taco. 5 stars for the enchilada. I wont be coming back.

We were a bit cranky and very hungry after our flight into Phoenix was delayed by more than 8 hours.  We needed a late supper en route to Sedona.  We didn't expect to find this gem - and are so glad we did!
Just a few minutes off of I-17, this is authentic family Mexican.  Great fresh salsa, just the right ratio of chunky to puréed tomatoes; outstanding Pork Carnitas which we split (with way too much left over).

Bring your appetite, and seek out La Piñata!
Delicious authentic tacos and enchiladas. I really liked the rice, beans, salsa and guac too. I ate until I was sick and still had leftovers. this place is worth the trip.

Authentic delicious Mexican food with trendy, ketchy decor! And a great outdoor patio that is dog friendly and oh so nice now that the weather has gotten so nice.  We come here often and have never been disappointed in the quality of the food, generous portions, and friendly service of the staff.  100% of the time we take part of our meal home so the value equates closer to two meals for the price of one.  My husband always orders the same thing, and has for years, the Carne Macacha dinner!  I i'm more adventurous and have tried just about everything on the menu and it's all been delicious. I've never been disappointed in one single bite. Guacamole is outstanding! I had the chicken tortilla soup on our last visit and it what is hearty and delicious! It is topped with fresh avocado and tortilla strips and cheese and is even better than mine and that's saying a lot!  If you want nonsense real deal Mexican food, this is the place!

Awesome neighborhood place! After scoping out possible places to dine in this area on yelp we settled on La Pinata because of the promising reviews about their stellar enchiladas! Never one to miss up on a good enchilada, we gave it a go and were very happy!!

The salsa was good, as were the chips, they kept 'em coming! I especially loved the lady with the salsa in a pitcher who wandered around the dining room giving our lil bowl refills on the regular! The tacos were awesome and so were the enchiladas!! YES! 

The food was fantastic, our only complaint was that the service was shit. We had this guy as our waiter, sorry didn't catch his name but he was ignoring us like CRAZY! We'd call for him, he'd give us the errect index finger asking for a minute and would never come! We didn't get refills on our sodas, until we asked for them from the salsa chick! Other tables that were seated after we arrived got their food before us and were out the door before us because he kept forgetting to bring us our check! 

We weren't especially rude, but after being fed up, I asked him if he was slammed that day. I knew he wasn't because there were three servers and about 12 tables filled, that's around 4 tables each and most of his other tables were just drinking and hanging out. He said no, and I asked then why are you ignoring us? No apology, nothing. He just laughed and walked away and kept on ignoring us. We tipped the salsa chick, paid and then left!

The food is AWESOME! don't get me wrong... but the service is reeeeally awful. Or atleast this guy was. The other servers seemed to be doing a better job. To my yelpers, I say: if you want good neighborhood mexican, go here. That is, If you have a lot of time on your hands and are very patient with crappy service. If you have neither of these things, then don't fret - there are PLENTY of other places nearby!
Really good and LOTS of food for the price. The staff was wonderful and very timely. Pork was a little dry but the salsa is great and very spicy. They have a good happy hour to.

Classic style Mexican food done nicely!  

Yummy crispy cheese crisp with a limey margarita will will win my heart any day of the week!  The classic frozen with a chambord float is my favorite and they do it well here.

The salad carbon was off the chain- served on a big platter and worked for me as 2 full dinners.

So far we have tried La Piñata twice, and have really enjoyed it! Cool design inside. The food has been excellent, one of our new favorite Mexican restaurants. So far we've tried the fajitas, the Chile relleno, the chimichanga and another chicken dish, but can't quite remember the name. All the dishes taste authentic without being the generic Mexican food you sometimes find in AZ.

Some places are just so a part of your childhood that they always remain a favorite.  La Pinata is one of those, I have been going here since before I was born... no seriously, my family has been regulars for decades.

Kids grow up and it had been quite sometime since I had been to La and went there for a birthday dinner recently.  Man oh man it was a blast from the past.. not much has changed.  There was a new pinata- Chicken Little.. made me smile & the Steak Piccado was off the menu.. but other than that is same ol' same ol' (including the non-pos terminals for servers.. which made me chuckle a bit).  And you know what it works.  That is what has kept people coming here forever.

Portions are huge, flavor is even bigger.  Support your local restaurants!!


(Btw.. for those of you who have been coming here for years, there is a new AZ history mini-book series available at Barnes & Noble and some Walgreens.. Well the one about Mexicans in Early Phoenix mentions a couple times throughout the book about Pete and his early days with the band.)

I have been going to La Pinata for the past 30+ years.  This is Mexican comfort food at its best.  The high quality of the food has remained the same over the years.  My "usual" is the Green Chili Burro, enchilada style. The green chili has consistently tender beef chunks in a rich beef and green chili gravy.  The crowning touch is the outstanding enchilada sauce.  With soft drinks, the meals for 2 cost a little over $20.  

Over the past few years we have ventured off our normal orders and have tried the chili relleno, tamales, cheese enchiladas, and the salad carbon.  Everything was absolutely delicious.  

The staff is always friendly.  Our usual waiter, Matt, always takes very good care of us.  

During the bad economy, I worried about this little family run business.  I am so happy to say that they are still going strong.  I highly recommend this restaurant to everyone.
La Pinata is really good Mexican at a reasonable price for enormous portions. Come hungry. Also come with patience because they don't take reservations so there will most likely be a wait
Seriously meh. The beans were good, but none of us really felt that any of the other food was more than adequate. Fast and decent service, but without good food what have you got?
We love this place. Been going since 2012 when they were at the old location. Still great, slightly more expensive at new location but still crazy delicious!

Stopped in for an early dinner and had great service. One of only a couple of places that serves a really good chile relleno. Our waiter kept my water topped up and even turned the plate so the stem was facing away from me. Fresh modern decor, very clean and even has a flat screen TV in the mens room...
Went here for the first time for lunch today. Good prices, fast service. The green chile burro was amazeballs! I'll definitely be coming back!

ok.  parking here is a joke.  you can come 10 minutes after they open and can't find a spot.  i get takeout because am alone and don't want eat there alone.  anyway, takeout food is generous and good but always cold.  Always.

I was pleasantly surprised by this place as I ride by it all the time. Finally gave it a try. The food was delicious and affordable Cool vibe and a great ambiance. They give you ample portions. Definitely worth the $$$.

LP's new location is IMO central Phoenix's best mexican restaurant. It is what Tee Pee used to be. Just solid, somewhat pricey but solid sloppy mexican food at its finest. Everything is great, simple, basic, by the book, mexican food. I did not like how they would not allow me to take home a meal off the children's menu for my daughter, even though the rest of our order was well above $60 but I guess that is their policy. Other than that, and the lack of attractive female bartenders, is the only qualm I have with this place.

Never went to the old location as it looked kinda shady. This location couldn't be any different. Very well decorated, the ambiance is top notch. The service was awesome, everyone working together. The food was awesome, I got their famous chimi and it didn't disappoint. The only thing that's weird is they opened up across the street from an established Mexican place, Sylvia's. That's kind of a dick move, but oh well let the people decide I guess. Anyway I highly recommend this place.

still grate food the new place is awesome I love it the service is a little rushed but they are so busy the food is the same as the old place witch I normally get the chimi witch is one of the best I think today I had the shrimp enchiladas they were OK to much sauce for but tasted good but a place to try if your in the area
We had lunch and the place was popular and fairly busy. We both had lunch Chimis and the green chili beef was very good. Great faculty and patio too

Went to the new location last night and was sadly disappointed.  Same food, higher prices, poor layout and loud, loud, loud.  We were at a round table and couldn't hear our table mates.  The waiter had to lean over and talk loudly into our ears to tell us "we don't have that, we don't have this."  Why is food on your menu if you don't have it??  If you want a family environment don't go here...the bar is the focal point of the room....the waiter said they were going for a more upscale feel....And it's reflected in the prices..... 4 alacarte tacos, an order of cheese dip and a bean burrito with no drinks....$44.00!!! What the what!!  This is Mexican food people and basic, mostly boring at that. We were excited that they were moving closer but it does us no good ...we'll travel a couple miles to Gloria's or go right across the street to Sylvia's.

Actually attempted to order take out from another restaurant nearby but had a bad phone experience and decided to try take out from this place instead. Glad I did. Food was excellent. We ordered the red chile combo, the taco combo and chicken fajitas.  The red chile was delicious and they didn't skimp on the meat like a lot of places do and give you mostly just sauce. Only reason for not giving a 5-star rating is that we got beef tacos instead of chicken like we ordered. They were still very good though. Order was ready at the time promised and staff was very pleasant. Will definitely be back.

Probably hands down my new favorite Mexican restaurant. The decor inside and out made me think of cafes in LA- very trendy and authentic. The food was so good- portions extremely generous and well priced for what you receive. Our server was excellent- and everyone around the restaurant helped each other out constantly. It's a bit of a drive, but we'll be back!
Everything is always great here- food and service! I love their chips and salsa. This is where I take out of town visitors for Mexican food and it's always a hit.

Best Mexican food that I've ever had- hands down! My fiancé and I eat here almost every week. Everything on the menu is amazing! Be sure to go for Taco Tuesday. We always ask for Reese as our server. He is so kind and enthusiastic- clearly loves his job.

I don't normally write reviews but I just dined here for lunch with my mom and two children (5 and 7) and I don't understand why it's so busy. Don't waste your money, go somewhere else, especially if you have younger children with you.
We waited about 10 minutes once we were seated to get our drink order. Then we waited another 15 minutes for those drinks to come and for our order to be taken. Once our food arrived the waitress never came back to fill our drinks or ask how everything was.
Nothing special about the food itself. My mom and I both had bean burrito enchilada styles. Which I thought for $7 was kind of expensive because it was a large flour tortilla with a small amount of beans and bland sauce. I had to put a bunch of salsa on it to give it some flavor because all I taste was the tortilla. Also it was recommended by the waitress to wait to give my children milk until the food arrived so I thought okay, sure. However by that time they had drank water and didn't really drink the milk (which happened to be $2.50 for a children's milk!). With all of that being said we'll never go back. There are much better places around. Bad service, bland food, and expensive for what you get.

Had seen good reviews here on Yelp, so decided to give it a try before heading out to the fair.  I was not disappointed.  I knew it was going to be good as soon as I walked in the door.  Not only was the food absolutely delicious, but the service was outstanding.  Our server was very attentive, salsa was refilled without asking, and not only were the drinks never empty, but plenty of ice in my iced tea.  Although the ice may sound like a minor thing to some, it scores big on my ratings.

The menu has all of the traditional offerings at an affordable price.

Although I live in Buckeye, I will definitely make the trip and come back again.

Stopped by for happy hour with friends, glad I did! The food was delicious, the happy hour prices reasonable and the service was excellent. The portions size of each app was large enough to share with two people! Will definitely visit again

Great food, authentic feel, and attentive service. 

"Do not judge a book by its cover" is what comes to mind when I think about our visit to La Piñata. I really enjoyed our server Jose as he was very upbeat and enthusiastic about the menu. The Guacamole appetizer  is awesome and their chips taste like they are homemade. 

Both my wife and I had great dishes - carnitas and combination fajitas. Both dishes were served with excellent homemade tortillas.  

I recommend this "hole in the wall" Mexican joint. It's guaranteed not to disappoint.

I really wanted to like this place, based upon a friend's recommendation and good Yelp reviews.  The chips and salsa were tasty and fresh, but that's where the goodness ended.  As an appetizer, we ordered the spinach queso dip.  The dip was runny and had the consistency of milk....not creamy at all.   For dinner, we each ordered the shrimp fajitas and they were pretty terrible.  The shrimp was cooked and served in a very sweet Asian style orange sauce (complete with real orange slices), looking and tasting more like an order of sweet and sour shrimp.  The shrimp itself was extremely rubbery and overcooked.  The beans and rice were okay, a little bland, but I shoved them in my tortilla to mask the taste and texture of the shrimp.  Drinks seemed watered down.  I felt sick the remainder of the night.  Will not be back.

Sopa pillas... And Mi Chilladas! Cool spot for Mexican food and cold beer! We stopped by after biking around the area on a gorgeous day. The wait can be crazy for dinner during the weekend. The Carnitas are a flavor explosion and the rice is a flaky yet tender surprise.

The best salsas in the valley so far. We have been going to a lot of places in the downtown, mid town, South Phoenix and Uptown Phoenix as well as here and there in other parts of the area. I detest a watery salsa, that is no more than straight from a can. La Pinata serves a thicker one with taste ( go figure that salsa should have taste) Then the hot isn't overwhelmingly out of balance with the rest of the taste in the hot salsa. It has a creamy texture and again it has flavor. That isn't even getting into the meals. They have good sized portions and great flavor.

This food is sooooo yummy! After years of searching finally found may favorite spot to eat. I've been twice and ordered the pollo favorites dish, and the yucitan burrito. The house marga are huge and delicious. The ambiance is great, and the owner obviously knows what good Mexican food tastes like. Maybe they will be on door dash or uber eats soon for delivery. We can only get there on date nights... So very rarely.

As a family who has visited this establishment more than once, I am very disappointed in the service I received recently and I will likely not be back. I was excited when this restaurant opened in my neighborhood ~ they took quite some time to offer "to go" food. I can appreciate  getting your bearings, but as a pregnant woman on strict bed rest who was craving Mexican food, it was disappointing that they were not able to serve us.

Their food is decent ~ tex~ mex only, if that's what you're in to. We don't go often but tonight after screwing up an at home dinner we thought we'd go. Now at home with twins, we also don't go out often but order to go food frequently.

When we ordered two meals and a kids quesadilla, we were told that they do not offer kids's meals to go.....because they do not have containers for kid's size meals. WHAT??? You can't offer me a kids quesadilla to go because the container is not the right size?

When pushed they said "no" because they just don't offer kids meals to go. So regular meals to go are finally ok, but no kids. If you offer it on your website, why don't you offer it to go? The manager, Terri, said that when the owner tells her something, she just does it, no questions asked.  So she couldn't even give me a a logical reason for not making me this kids meal.

With only decent food and ridiculous "rules" of business that you can't justify or explain, I will happily take my family's business, kids included, elsewhere.
Still good as they always been, new location is cool. Wish they'd bring back carne asada torta.

We loved this place at their old location on 19 Ave., and, we love this location, too. The new location is beautiful without the tradition kitschy decor, but, a tasteful modern feel. The food is almost the same as before, with some of the best Carne Macache in town. The chip and salsa are very good, along with the offerings of the full bar. They offer both indoor and patio seating. The service is still very good. It can get very busy, especially on weekends, but, well worth the wait.

Awsome Mexican food!! Especially if you're new around here and coming from California!! The owner and staff are great and perfect on their customer service. Came in for a to go and the owner was so nice and sweet she convinced us to stay and eat. Beautiful on the inside as well!! Well satisfied

La Pinata feels like a true, authentic Mexican restaurant in the heart of Downtown Phoenix. Parking is a little tight (as is most parking lots in that area). The restaurant itself feels large, but cozy. Well decorated with an outside area. 
The Bentley margarita is amazing! The chips came out warm and the salsa had the perfect amount of spice. The server was very sweet and frequently checked on us. 
We came earlier in the night, but by 5:30 pm it was packed. I saw many large groups. Overall a great experience. I would recommend to anyone in the area!

I wish I could give this place 5 stars. The food is always really good and fast. The reason this place is receiving 3 stars is the service and the cooks. 

Every time I order my food, I ask for no garnish. Not too big of a request, I just don't want a side salad with my Mexican food. It never fails, they GIVE ME IT ANYWAY! 

EVERY. SINGLE. TIME.

It seems small but I come here often and it happens every time. 

Second, the Grey haired older lady always has a shit attitude. Not once has she been pleasant to anyone. I don't know what her deal is but she makes the place look bad. As harsh as it sounds. 

Besides that, like I said earlier, the food is amazing. The waiters are awesome. The ladies who refill chips and drinks are always on it! If the kitchen could get their shit together a little and if the lady could be more pleasant, this place would be perfect.
Pros:Food is good, locations is pretty. Cons: not home made beans, bad service, very pricey.

This is the best Mexican food I've ever had. To be fair, I just moved here from the Midwest, but I've still eaten a LOT of Mexican in my life. La Pinata is unmatched in terms of price, portion, flavor, and overall quality. A $12 appetizer nachos supreme filled up both my girlfriend and I. If it wasn't so unbelievably flavorful we even would've had leftovers. The fried ice cream defied all expectations by coming with a chocolate tortilla. The flavor of the ice cream and toppings would've been fantastic by themselves. We will be returning on a weekly basis. Highly recommend.
Green Chile Con Carne, Tio Pancho's Pollo Con Queso, Carne Asada, Tamalito de Mi Tia Carlotta, Flautas, Huevos Rancheros, Chicken Chimi, one for each day of the week!

The food is just as awesome as it ever was but there is a problem with an old school waitress. She was no fun at the old place and it continues today. I'm kind of recognizable so she probably has it out for me. Tonight I signed my bill with a note, I wrote, "Poor service equals poor tip, please apologize to the bussing staff". I felt terrible stiffing the kids but I felt I needed to express how I perceived her service. The other servers were working like rock stars and showing attention to each and every table. 
To be true to the guidelines I will not mention names but many long time visitors probably know who I am talking about. It wasn't the half bowl of chips she started with or not noticing my tasty Michelada was empty when the food came and never dropped by to see if I might like another for the next 30 minutes. The next time we saw her was when we finished our meal and had to call out to get her attention for a check.
I should have written, "Poor hospitality equals poor tip". When she brought out our food I asked her how the seafood place was doing that moved into their old location. She replied smartly that "She doesn't go that far south", making me instantly feel that she just disrespected the entire neighborhood that I have enjoyed for over 50 years. I know she has gone that far south, she worked there for years. I had no idea that moving 3 and a half miles would change people so much. Not a lot of love tonight, via con dios amigos... I can name a half dozen competitors that love my business and sell Tecate.

The Cheesiest of the Cheese mines! Arizona's authentic capillary clogging dining experience! 
Come here for the traditional Arizona Cheese Crisp! Cheese Enchiladas! Red or Green Burros! they have all the staples. Service is always quick and friendly even when they are packed on Mother's day. Slip in the bar for some snacks or drinks and feel right at home in the cozy little nook.

Staff is out of this world. Very sweet and very considerate. They definitely make the experience. True Mexican food that is ALWAYS good. If you don't like what you get, they find something you do. Seriously so awesome. And great chips and salsa!

I never visited the old location, but I love the way they have redone the old Mary Coyle's building on 7th Avenue and turned it into a great, upscale Mexican food restaurant. We visited with a group of seven people and had an excellent experience. Service was fast and attentive and the food was excellent.

Between us we tried everything from the carne machaca dinner to the shrimp enchiladas suizas, the enchilada combo plate, and the chimichangas. (As a side note, its funny that La Pinata also lays some claim to the chimichanga as I'd thought the debate was strictly between Macayo's in Phoenix and El Charro in Tucson who both claim to have invented the dish. La Pinata is careful not to claim to have invented the chimichanga, but they certainly play up their connection to it).

Everyone was very happy with the food they had and most of us went home with enough to eat again the next day for lunch.

Now that they are in my neighborhood I have no doubt that I will be returning!

I've been coming to La Piñata for years and it is consistently delish!! Rice and beans are a deciding factor for me and theirs are YUM. I've never had anything not good! Do yourself a favor and ask for the hot salsa!

I ordered the Mexican tortilla stack thing on my next visit. It was awesome. Highly recommend. Didn't leave room for friend ice cream though. Still regretting it because it looks so good. 

Read my original review for more info.

I had not been to this location of LaPinata since they moved from the old location awhile back.  I was pleasantly surprised.  The new location (the old Mary Coyle shop) did seem like an upgrade to me and everything was great.  We were there on Sunday, June 19 arriving about 5:15pm.  The restaurant was busy and having a large party we had called ahead and the wait was not long.

The food was very tasty and hot.  But the best part of the visit was our server.

There were 9 in my party for dinner which will challenge even the best server.  Jose N. did a superb job with our table.  Just the right touch of knowing when to fill water, salsa, etc. 

Kudos to Jose.  We look forward to dining with you again !!

It's in a neighborhood that looks to be conducive to quality Mexican food.  I mean crap, Chi Chi's Cabaret is right up the road (apparently).  But I think the food failed to hit the mark in terms of outstanding Mexican/Sonoran fare.  It was lackluster and not very tasty.

Lots of decent reviews caused me to go out of my way to eat here with my family.  The prices were a little steep for the food they gave.  $12 dollar enchilada plates and $10 dinner specials.  

I'd have to say the stand out entree of the night was my plate.  I ordered the MP-1 which was basically a Green Tamale dinner.  It was actually pretty good.  I like the hint of sweetness that is present in the masa.  The beans were decent as well and tasted homemade not canned.

But there wasn't anything very 'Green' in any of the flavor of the entree.  

Otherwise, everything was pretty standard.  Service was great.  Food came fast.  But all in all, I wasn't knocked off my feet.  

I might possibly give this place another chance.  I really did like the ambience and location.  We'll see.

Solid food, generally good flavor.  They kick the food out the kitchen in a very timely manner!  The pollo con queso Chimi is very good.  Stay away from the chile relleno if you grew up in NM like me, you'll be disappointed!  Not a real green Chile.  It's a stuffed Anaheim Pepper, that's far from stellar!  Otherwise, excellent service, like the new location on 7th Ave!  Will go back and stick with what I know to be good.

This was my first time to this establishment. I gave it 4 stars because they seated us right away, swift with getting our drinks, and entree.  I ordered the seafood enchilada dinner and my wife had the chimichanga combo. I am a big connoisseur of seafood, however the enchiladas didn't pique my palet. However the chimichanga was amazing. Other than the enchiladas, everything was great. Definitely going to come back.

Jeez- why did this place have to move from the older location?  The quality of the food has gone south big time! The tortilla chips with the chips and salsa were all broken into small pieces. The margarita on the rocks was ALL sweet mixer and very little tequila. The red chili beef is now very greasy- total let down. My wife had the pork carnitas burro- the pork was SO dry and bland. What happened??? Seems like they became too popular too quickly at the new location and the quality control is gone. Extremely disappointed and sad. Doubt we will return.

Food wasn't that good. Server was kind. Leonard, one of the owners was not friendly at all. We ordered before 6pm for the happy hour special and they charged us full price and said we ordered after 6 and wouldn't give us the happy hour prices. The ticket showed 6:38pm, well after our order. I wouldn't recommend this place.

The food was delicious! Huge portions and a great price. I had the spinach and cheese enchiladas. They were very filling and not greasy. There was so much food that I took half home and I'm looking forward to leftovers tomorrow. The staff was attentive. The ambiance was modern. They have a nice patio. The restaurant is not very big and it fills up fast. They have a decent Mexican beer selection and a full bar. I will definitely be back!

Good chips good salsa not much selection of white meat chicken and the few dishes I've had have had a lot of fat and gristle on them .. the fajita chicken is fatty as well as the pollo Azteca the last time I ate there the chicken was very fatty and almost undercooked I ended up not eating most of it and tried to fill up on chips .. wait staff and management is great I've been coming here for years chicken cuts have gotten worse

This is our favorite Mexican Restaurant to go to hands down! You can usually find us here every 2 weeks! The staff is always so kind and cheerful! The food is delicious! If I ever get married in the future I would love for this restaurant to cater for me!

This place is pretty good!  For starters we ordered the cheese crisp.  It was very cheesy and surprisingly not burnt like most places are.  Then I ordered the Tio Panchos pollo con queso.   Nicely seasoned and very tasty.  I even liked the refried beans which were "smoky" in taste.   My wife ordered the red burro, taco, and bean tostada combo meal.   She says she liked the red chili meat in the burro.  The only thing I feel they could improve on is their salsa.   Both the regular and hot salsas were lacking flavor and "punch".

Why is this place busy? ? ?
We stopped because of all the cars. A lot of cars must be good right? I don't know what the attraction was. The food wasn't bad.....it just wasn't anything special. I have had better many, many times. And all the cars? Really?
Very welcoming atmosphere got stuck sitting in the bar stools but not bad! Good food and service

I have been going to La Piñata for about 25 years. I was hesitant to go to their new location on 7th Avenue because I was unsure if it had new owners (new menu, etc.), but no (same owners and employees).  Their food has stayed consistent and their hospitality is wonderful as always. Thank you for not changing a thing! I love the new modern look. The old place on Osborn and 19th Avenue was okay, but I love the new location for sure! The food has stayed the same, DELICIOUS! Thank you!
Love me some authentic Mexican good. With the pipping hot plates the food is delicious. The new location is always packed. Great chips and salsa and I recommend the beef enchiladas.

My uncle worked at la piñata while he was going to ASU..about 20 years ago. So I've been coming here for years. Not my go to Mexican place usually..but with their new location it could be. 

It's super cute! They needed the upgrade. 

I sat at the bar - ordered a michilada. The bartender made up their own. It was pretty good. 
The menu design is a headache. Stuff all over - confusing. I didn't see a enchilada, taco, tostada, bean and rice combo. So I went with the relleno, taco and tostada. Chips and salsa was delivered promptly. The chips - a little stale the salsa -- well it wasn't ketchup thankfully. But s jalapeño wasn't in the top 8 ingredients. 

The food was okay. For all the white people in the area.. This place will be off the cha..ughh it will be busy and do well. I'll stick to tacos atoyac. I need some spice to my life.

Excellent food! Stopped here in a whim. Best Mexican food I've had in a long time. I had the Chimichanga with shredded beef. Excellent flavor. Great salsa, guacamole. Ilene was an awesome server, every time I thought to even ask for something it appeared on my table before I asked. Truly great lunch.

Went on opening weekend so they were out of a few things.  Still trying to figure out the kitchen.  Forgiven.  However what we did order was fantastic and the owners, waitress, and overall ambience was 5 star!  Fun hip place, clean, modern- made us feel like family there.
Dear LJ, keep getting your beans from Sylvias,  that all she deserves! Oh and she will Charge you for the to go container!

This place is a little out of my neck of the woods, but a girlfriend of mine took me here to celebrate my birthday... and what a lovely, fun birthday it was!

The dining room was very clean and the decor was lovely!!!   It was a very nice and comfortable atmosphere.   

The server was VERY attentive and genuinely seemed concerned about my $#%-ing tomato allergy and making sure my dinner would require the Paramedics and a stint in the E.R. afterwards.  

We started out with a cheese crisp and it was PERFECT.  Melt in your mouth good!  

I decided on a great green chili tamale dinner.  Unfortunately, I was not able to have the chili topping, but the tamale was delicious!  It was moist and very flavorful and nice big strips of fresh green chili!   

The beans were AMAZING!  Just the right amount of melted cheese on top...  the tortilla chips were perfect!  Nice, thin, and crispy.  Freshly made for sure. 

The server was so fantastic, he brought me a delicious and HUGE order of fried ice cream for my birthday... I'm not usually a fan of fried ice cream, but this stuff was fantastic! 

I saw on the drink menu that they serve Prickley Pear margaritas, which I cannot wait to go back and try!

Besos La Pinata!

The menu has changed, and not for the better. They've changed the recipe for the ice in my tea. It never used to melt when the tea was gone. Now, it melts while I'm waiting for the tea to be refilled.

Love the new location! We have been eating here 20 years and it's still our number one Mexican restaurant. We drive 20 miles to have lunch/dinner here regularly. If you read a review that doesn't like the food, they're from the east coast and don't know good Mexican. The food here is consistently fantastic. Yes sometimes you wait and sometimes you have to ask for something twice BUT WHO CARES when the food is so delicious. The prices are fair, $9 for lunch. When did that become expensive? I paid $10 for a freaking salad and sandwich at paradise bakery the other day. 
Go enjoy this place, you'll be hard pressed to find anything better.

It is hit or miss... all depends on who is working. The host that was working, he was very friendly. The waitress was in a hurry, and had to be reminded to bring stuff, but it was busy. I think it just a good casual Mexican restaurant. The drinks will not wow you.. I suggest the ordering 2 items and doing a half and half.. Parking Sucks!! So if you cannot find a spot.. just leave and come back another day.. I have eaten here many times.. so you be the judge!

Great local Mexican place. 
Decent parking and friendly staff. 
Good food. 
Solid dependable reasonably priced.

We really enjoyed our dinner at La Piñata  last night... it was our first time going there for dinner.
The fresh made guacamole and chips were yummy.
We had fajitas.... I had chicken, others ordered steak, and someone ordered shrimp fajitas. We all loved our dinners.... the portions are large and cooked perfectly. The entree comes with your choice of tortilla and beans  as well as the typical accompaniments.
I look forward to going back again!

Manager returned my complaint with a come back we'll get it straight attitude but must not have told staff.Turned down again and lady at front told me it was lunch hour and she had no time for me and MY problem. You have a lot of people coming in so what does one 14 year customer mean to you,not much I can tell

Wow.. I cant tell you how angry I left this place. They don't care if they made a mistake (seat someone else in front of you after waiting 10 minutes). All you get is attitude even from upper management. Won't be going to this place any time soon.

I came here on an early Friday night and there wasn't a wait, so that was nice. The parking lot is a little tight and we did notice a wait/packed lot when we left close to 7 pm. The atmosphere was rather dull and I honestly was underwhelmed from the reviews I read and the 4 star rating. The service was decent and happy hour menu had some good items available. I loved the reg. queso and the fried flour tortilla chips served  with it! Made me think I was back home in Texas! The salsa is a typical traditional red salsa that was good, but nothing to rave about. I had the la pina cocktail that was surprisingly not too sweet, but not sure if it's worth $9. I shared beef fajitas with the hubby and we were surprised with the restaurants' version of fajitas. It was literally slow cooked brisket style fajitas with a brown gravy on top? But it did come with a generous amount of refried beans and rice. Our meal came with 3 tortillas and we asked for more to take home with our leftovers. We were charged for $1.50 for 2 tortillas... I've NEVER had to pay extra for tortillas lol. I wasn't even informed it would cost extra especially since they weren't anything special . I think it's kind of silly that a restaurant at this price point feels the need to charge their customers who probably spends a good amount of money to dine at their establishment. As a couple we spent $50 with a tip and have gotten more value and satisfaction at other Mexican restaurants. Was this place terrible? No. was it worth the money? No. Was it a fun and cool atmosphere? No. 2 months ago I ordered Uber eats from a Mexican restaurant at the same price point and similar style and got waaaay more of a value and was super pleased with just a to- go order! I think that says a lot.

I'm only on the salsa and it's just as fabulous as always. I love the new location and the decor is beautiful. Open 5 days and the place is standing room only. To the previous negative commentor, they are way took busy to fill an order for beans. Go across the street....you'll be angry lol.

My husband and I love La Piñata! We were even there twice this week. 

Whether you are sitting at the bar or at a table, you will receive great service! When we sat outside, our server was energetic and attentive. The drinks and food came out quickly and were delicious. When we sat at the bar, the chips and salsa were served promptly and so were our drinks.

If you like margaritas, I highly recommend the margarita made fresh and upgrade the tequila to Hornitos. Oh my gosh, so good! 

For food, we ordered a kids meal which was a great size and price. I ordered the Salad Carbon with grilled chicken. That jalapeño ranch is delightful too! My husband ordered the Tacos Del Mar and was very satisfied. 

Also, one of my favorite things about La Piñata is their decor. The little piñata that serves as their mascot is just the cutest. Also, no matter where you sit you will be comfortable.

Check this place out, it's pretty awesome!

Overall a good experience. I'd give La Piñata 3.5 stars if half stars were possible. The supremo nachos with half machaca beef & half chicken were good and plentiful, but the chips were a little soggy.  I suggest skipping the chicken as the beef had much better flavor. 
We also had a combo plate with a cheese enchilada, green corn tamale, and a guacamole taco.  All were good. It's way too much food for me though.  The tamale and taco were great the enchilada was average mainly because the sauce was just average.  
Service was good. Good atmosphere.  We dined inside , but the patio looked nice with a fire.

Big fan of this place, one of my  happy hour hangouts. The food is good, try their mechaca and shredded tacos. Their house margaritas are strong and tasty.  It looks alittle dive but still attracts a large following and is a local favorite in the area,  Great bartender-Daniel will take good care of you. Overall, a great family restaurant!

The new place is nice and new.  Parking is a problem  unless you get there early.  Tha salsa was not spicy. Chips were marginal , a little on the cold side . I had green chili burro and  a taco . Green chili was salty. And the meat overcooked.  Taco had too much cheese . Combinations  were a little pricy. RICE was firm. Service was a little  slow . For the neighborhood  I prefer Los compadres

Tried the new location. Place is much no we inside . Service  was much better . They were very attentive  . Food was good and potions were large and ftesh..my previous  complaint  was that the food was too salty. Rice and beans were over cooked.place was busy.  The price was reasonable

We had dinner.we had to wait to be seated when the restaurant only had about 5 tables. I had to ask for their hot sauce twice .they gave us two basket of chips for a party or 5 and never asked whether we wanted more .I ordered the green chili and the pork was WY overcooked , the sauce was flavorful their taco meat way way too dry and it took about  10 minutes for the server to pick up the check  the bill had tips calculated for 18 and 20 percent. I would not plan on going back

I go here about once a week for lunch. Love their "burrito in my taco" lunch special, as well as huevos rancheros, taco salad and cheese crisps. The staff make a you feel like family every time you walk in.

The food is fabulous. Love the chips and salsa. Everything is pretty much always amazing. Only bad thing, I'd have to say is the guacamole has very little if any flavor. I love supporting local businesses.

Great neighborhood restaurant.  Casual dining with a comfortable dining area.  Staff was extremely friendly and attentive.  Ordered the combo beef and chicken fajitas with corn tortillas.  Food was excellent, chicken and beef cooked perfectly, grilled vegetables, guacamole, and rancho beans were great.  Crowded for a Thursday night but order was taken promptly and food was delivered quickly. Prices are reasonable.

I had been once before today and on the journey I was charged twice for my meal. I alerted the person on the phone when I called ans they said it would be taken care of, it never was

But this after noon we the office went to say goodbye to an agent going on to another office. We had a few plates of assorted appetizers and of course chips. The chips were so very bland as was everything else, except for the corn tamale which was freakishly sweet. I think most of my office enjoyed. But who knows no one really said.

The wait persons are very attentive and nice.

This place is a staple for me and my husband.  We're trying to get through the menu, but have our favorites so it's hard.  Happy hour is great too!  House margarita is delish.  Chips & salsa - can't go wrong and can't stop eating.

Do you like "Mexican" food? Do you LOVE cheese? La Pinata is for you then!

I was surprised at the inauthenticity of the place given its location but cannot complain about the actual food. I had the Pollo Azteca and it was very tasty. The chicken was well seasoned and cooked and absolutely smothered in cheese. The portions are a perfect size: eat half at the restaurant and take half home for lunch tomorrow. Please do not attempt to eat it all in one sitting, Phoenix does not need any more morbidly obese people. Seriously, we have too many already.

I live in the neighborhood and have been eating here for years. (Both take out and dine in). I don't know if they have new cooks or what, but the quality of the food has slowly gone down hill in the last (6) months to the point I don't think we'll eat there again. The refried beans WERE FROM A CAN. I know homemade versus canned and these are canned. The Cheese Crisp was really lacking and very oily. The shredded beef taco had a lot of fat on the beef. This place used to serve really good Mexican food. Not so anymore. We're going back to Sylvia's La Canasta or Macayo's. Much better food, and not from a can.

Ah, the quintessential gringo Mexican restaurant! (And that's a good thing!)

Nothing here moves beyond stereotype, and what we'd expect to find in a good quality, long standing Mexican restaurant in this town. The food, the decor, the menus - all of it is like the Central Casting version of a Mexican Restaurant.

Ice cold Negra Modelo and a HUGE platter of nachos.
PERFECT afternoon snack!

You bet tus naglas I will be back!

Came in with coworkers. This place is excellent. I had the carne asada burrito and it had tender steak that melted in my mouth. The guacamole inside was heavy on the citrus which made it pop. If you are downtown and want a good Mexican place to drop in i would really recommend La Pinata!

Love this place!!!  My husband and I always sit in the bar area...great, friendly service! They have, by far, the best margaritas I have ever tasted...and I think the food is one of the better Mexican's in this area.  The fajitas are delicious and way more than enough for 2. I would also like to add, that I love the decor! And its always busy...it has a following of locals, and that is a great sign!
We had excellent service and the cheese crisp was fantastic! Thanks Matt for the being a wonderful server!

I've been to this place a number of times for lunch.  Quickly becoming one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in the Phoenix area.  Ordered multiple items, everything is excellent!  Recommendations include the Chorizo and eggs platter, carne asada burrito, and machacca burrito.   We've had Maggie be our sever a few occasions and she is tremendous.  Always offering recommendations, very personable and conversational.  The host (who I assume is one of the owners as well) is also wonderful to talk with.  One tip - be sure to ask for their hot salsa with your chips if you are a fan of spicy foods!

For delicious Mexican food in north Phoenix, try La Piñata. This was our visit here and we were so stunned by the speed in which our food was prepared that we were sure it was meant for another table. The food was hot and fresh and well within our budget. My husband got a beef chimichanga and I got bean and cheese burrito, which we both enjoyed. Chips and salsa arrived immediately; the salsa tastes sweeter than most and is equally flavorful. We will be back!
Very nice lunch for 4. All entrees enjoyable. Especially steak. Readonably priced abundance of food to take home. Nice service quiet atmosphere not fancy just good food at reasonabl prices

My family and I are always hunting around town looking for good spots to eating in hopes of finding that diamond in the rough. Let me tell you we didn't find much here, the ambiance was  cold in feeling and an eye sore, it was a clash of better homes/home and garden meets  Santa Fe living room... nothing to do with good Mexican food. Anyways.... To the point... The food was just ok. Nothing I haven't
Still a fan!  Their chimichangas are the best!  Their margaritas aren't as good as I remember, at least the happy hour regular one.  Too much mix?

I am pretty sure that I have reviewed this place already, but I sort of feel like every time we go here I fall in love all over again!

I just ate the left overs from last night, because I couldn't manage to finish my plate after having one of the "Casa Margaritas" and enough chips to put me in a certain food coma... The left overs were just as good this morning as they were last night! DUH. 

This place has the best everything in town. No joke. 

Do yourself a favor, if you like spinach, get the Spinach Enchiladas dinner. 

And don't leave without trying the house margarita. On the rocks. With salt. 

Just do it.
This place is amazing! We walked in with 13 volleyball players, sat on their lovely patio with Matt taking such good care of us!  Good food , great service! Individual checks!
Chicken Tortilla Soup, to die for! Also best Chicken enchilada! Has a neighborhood feel with very excellent food.

I called La piñata to help cater a party. I was appalled at the service and unwillingness to accommodate my needs. They advertise only needing two hours to put together a party platter, so when I called on Wednesday I never assumed that there would be any issues with getting one by the following Saturday. 

I had a huge number of vegetarians coming to the party and just needed to make slight modifications to some, not all, of the platter items; replacing meat with beans. Seems simple right? I guess not. I was told that I would have to call back on Thursday to speak to the owner about my modifications. 

Long story short, I'm not even sure that they make the food fresh there at this point. There was no way to make any modifications, and the owner even refused to swap the non-vegetarian options with other items from the menu that already were set up without meat. I was told by him, THE OWNER, that I needed to go somewhere else. Then he hung up on me when I replied that I would be sure to share my experience with others. 

Sad.

The food was most excellent, my first time here with some friends on a birthday. We got sat in a corner, five of us, waitress took our orders and we got served our drinks and didn't come back until we got served our food. I actually had to get up and go find an employee to get us more water. 

I think we got full on ice, chips and salsa by the time we got our food, but it's all good, we got full all over again. 

We didn't see our server again until we got our checks, next time I'm gonna ask we sit in the middle of the restaurant.

Again food was excellent, the service could use some improving. Pay attention, it's not a very big place.

Best Salsa, BEST fajitas hands down and good customer service! Been eating here since I was a little kid. Definitely, my all time favorite Mexican food restaurant!
