Need I say more?
First time and loved it! The service was amazing, food came out super fast and it was delicious. Our New Mexican spot for sure!

Once again, La Piñata came through with a fantastic meal!   I was very happy to hear that my favorite item, Aunt Carlotta's mini tamales, is coming back to the menu!  Thank you so much for making my mom's 82nd birthday awesome.  We were there last year on your first day, too!

We have loved La Piñata since the 80s when we moved to Phoenix.  The chips and salsa are fresh, the margaritas are tangy, and the green corn tamales are the best ever.  I usually get the Aunt Carlotta's green tamale special, as I did tonight.  I'll be miserable before I'm done but I can't quit eating it!  So good!
Outstanding place!  Wife had the spinach enchiladas I had the carnitas dish and they were both excellent!  Great atmosphere and we loved it.  We will be back.

We arrive for the first time, greeted immediately with a smile and seated promptly. Our server was fantastic, he was funny and fast. Gave great suggestions on the menu and we both were very pleased with the food, flavors, speed and accuracy of our orders. We will definitely be going back for more great food!

This restaurant has been around since 1970! We were welcomed immediately and seated fast. One of the original owners, who is in his 70's, still works there and is the sweetest man. He talked and joked with us and made us feel very welcome. The salsa and chips are DELICIOUS and are made in house. Our server was adorable and so sweet. Too bad it's so far or I would love to go more often.

Passing through from L.A. to Austin, I wasn't expecting much. Boy was I impressed. First, the portions are huge. I felt my belt expanding with every spoonful consumed. The price was about $14 a plate, but given the huge volume of food, it's worth it.  It's basically two meals - one for now and one for sobering up later after too much tequila. Go here. Get the Pollo Azteca. It will make you happy. Love, Chicano Lawyer.

This is my "go-to" Mexican food place in the valley.  The chips are plentiful, fresh, and light - the salsa is chunky, not to spicy (but you can order hotter). Service is fast. Parking at lunch hour is difficult - but outside of the lunch hour no problem. They have been here forever. It's a family run business. Favorite dish... cheese enchilada w/ the GREEN sauce most definitely, second - try steak picada - a not to miss dish. They will make the chees crisps extra crispy upon request, which is great - and have fresh tea and great beer.  It's a simple no fuss Mexican food place.  Low cost too.  Love that they don't try to "fancy up" the dishes - just nice simple home style cooking - what we all want sometimes.

After having been regulars at the old location on 19th avenue for years (and having reviewed it a couple of times), we were excited to visit the restaurant's new home. We had great expectations, and we can honestly say that we were not disappointed whatsoever.

The new site, which was once the old Mary Coyle's ice cream parlor, has been transformed into this superb Mexican food restaurant.  Every aspect of the new place is simply head and shoulders above their old locale.The parking is more spacious and less scary, the bathrooms are modern and expansive, and the whole interior was well laid out and just evoked an upscale bistro look.

The food, which was the highlight of visiting the old location, was even better - if that was even possible. My wife commented that her chimichanga was really crispy on the bottom, and the meat was very well cooked and seasoned. And my #4 (Taco, Burro, and Tostada) was simply scrumptious. And the flan I had was simply superb. It tasted like it was even more freshly made than normal, just for us.

Even though I have rated them 4 stars in previous reviews, I had to give them 5 stars for the astounding service. Marleen, our server, was just amazingly efficient, friendly and courteous. 

All the supporting wait staff, including the lady that saw my glass empty from all the way across the room and came over to provide me a refill, were just simply astounding in their attention to detail. I had never complained about their service before in the smaller locale, but they really did elevate their performance here at the new place.

Although we had to wait for about 25 minutes, even though we didn't have to really wait before at the old location, that did not detract whatsoever from our experience. However other regulars were complaining about having to wait. They obviously haven't been to eat in downtown Gilbert on Fridays and Saturdays and wait for an arduously long period for a table - anywhere there! That will certainly get you to appreciate the diminutive time spent waiting at this restaurant.

The location, the food, the environment and decor, and most especially the service deservedly receives 5 stars from us! 

We are now truly unabashed fans of the sensational new location.

We ordered 2 fajita Burros, some beans and some queso. The meat in the burritos was super dry. There was practically no peppers and onions so it was basically a meat burrito and not a fajita burrito and there was no sauce or anything in it. Overall super dry and bland. The queso tasted like Velvetta. Not impressed at all.

Currently studying for a rather important and daunting licensing exam and decided to take a break and get out of the house for dinner with my husband. We just moved here a few weeks ago and decided to try La Piñata for the first time! The decor was really cool, and the porch looked like a fun place to hang out and eat, but it was sort of chilly so we ended up sitting inside. I ordered a mango house margarita to drink. When it arrived, it was most definitely not mango (it was lime), but I was enjoying it, so I told the waitress not to worry about having it remade and to just remove the surcharge from our ticket for the flavoring. Apparently the manager wouldn't have that and said I either had to have my drink remade or I was paying for the surcharge. So, I had the drink remade. It was right the second time. I worked in food service in varying capacities for several years and would have never, ever said that to a customer, though. When our chips & chili con queso got to the table, there was a long black hair attached to one of the chips (I'm blonde, my husband has light brown hair). I didn't say anything because the impression I was given when I complained about the margarita was that the manager would likely think I was just looking for a write off on my ticket. When our food arrived, it was great. Not a single problem and everything tasted fantastic. When we were finishing up, though, an upset employee (manager maybe?) busted into the kitchen and LOUDLY (loud enough for the entire main dining room to hear and turn around) said: "if you guys don't start cleaning off the f****** tables outside...". Very, very unprofessional to use profane language when dealing with employees or coworkers, and even worse to say it loud enough that customers can hear. Our server, Lindsey, was great. She did everything right! Management, on the other hand, could use some worK. Certainly not the experience I was hoping for tonight.

I will say that if it weren't for the great food, I would not keep coming back time and time again.

The parking stinks, the neighborhood is not very inviting, and parking in the back and walking through the dimly lit and narrow alley at times is quite revolting.

However, the food is just great here. Nothing too fancy or special, but what they do serve day in and day out is quite tasty.

From the freshly made chunky salsa along with the fresh cilantro, to the main course, and ultimately the Flan for dessert - it just all works very well for a great Mexican food experience.

We were informed that they are actually moving by the end of September. We are looking forward to enjoying their food at their new location.

Came here on a whim, on a stop-over for a flight to Hawaii. The front desk guy told me about this place, saying that it was worth the cab ride out there. And boy was it! The rice was so fluffy and paired with the Back Beans it was perfect. I ordered some Enchiladas and the Pollo Asada and washed it down with 2 slamming, potent Margarita's! But I punked out at the end of the meal and ordered the Gringo tourist special-Fried Ice Cream. Such is life.....

I moved away from Phoenix 11 years ago and was eating Cal Mex too long.  This weekend I was in Phoenix and tried La Piñata and love it.  I had forgotten how real mexican food should taste.  My mom had Cocida and was in heaven and I had Chile Verde and it was terrific.  Chips and salsa was perfect.  Fresh, thin, not greasy and warm.  Perfect compliment for the salsa.  I read the reviews on the service and my experience was just right.  I'm going back when I visit Phoenix again.

Whenever I am on the west side, want Mexican and want to splurge, this is the place to go! Food is definitely the best around. I've been searching for a place like this since I moved to Phoenix.  Some people may dislike the decor and blah blah, I think it gives it a distinguished feel. 

Our waitress that served our group of six was on top of her game and all her other tables. She re-filled the chips and salsa a whopping three times. I kept eating them, chip after chip, saying to myself, "these chips are so light and the salsa is so fresh"!

Lunch menu gives healthy portions at a great price. I had the chicken fajitas and had enough food to last a week. I am definitely going to come back to enjoy more of the variety off the menu. Of course I over ate :)

La Piñata. One word, Yum.
Best Mexican food by far. Service was outstanding. Food was fresh. Recommended without hesitation.

Went there on Mothers Day, the chicken fajitas were great! The portion size was big enough to split between two but we did not know that so we we took the leftovers home; a nice bonus! The chicken tamale my daughter ordered was huge too and very good. My other daughter ordered the taco plate with rice and beans, it looked fabulous. I did not taste it but she said it was great. We ordered the fried ice cream for desert and it was great too! The waitress was very pleasant and she made sure our drinks were always full, asked if we wanted additional salsa without us having to ask for it. 
We will go back!!!!

History and nostalgia only will take you so far. La Pinata has been here for a very long time and servs decent quality mexican food. However it is nothing special or unique.

The fast service the chips was apreciated by all, the lunch menu has many options than end up costing ~$10-12 with tax and tip. 

It is hard to say much else as this place is simple mexican and my enchilada was decent.,

This is hands down my favorite Mexican food restaurant! I continue trying new items each time I go and have yet to be disappointed. 
Eat.Drink.Dessert. You'll love it!
Great food great service!  Waiter Anthony is a cutie and keeper

This has become a place I visit weekly for lunch. They have updated their POS system, so splitting checks is no problem. They do have the most amazing tortilla chips, my mouth is watering thinking about it. Best mexican food in this area! om nom nom nom.
One of my longtime favorites! We love family owned restaurants who care about quality food! Their new location is beautiful and very clean. Thank you Ya Piñata ; ) we look forward to every visit!
Great, authentic Mexican food. My family has been coming here since the 70's. Everything we've tried has been great!
The manager is so rude. Get rid of her and I'll be back. Really lady...all I asked for was chips!!

We have not been here for years (5+) the food is not as good as I remember it being. The service was OUTSTANDING!!!! Our waiter Matt was so good he had a great attitude joking with us and very pleasant. He was on the ball. Next time you dine here you have to ask for Matt.

I am so disappointed in this location.  They took over the old ice cream shop that used to be here.  Food is good but over priced.  Still, good food.

This has happened in multiple occasions.  Called to place an order, person on the phone asks me 2-3 times what it is.  I clarify my order and they repeat and give me the time frame.  20 mins.  They sound busy so I give them 10 extra to be safe.

We arrived to pick up our order.  It's wrong.  They ask us to wait for them to remake it.  Businesses, if you make a mistake, and your customers have to wait while you fix it, a good practice is to redeem the experience in some way so that they return.

Sadly, this has happened too many times and we're done.  Adios la piñata.

Food is ok, service is terrible.   Gave this new location another chance becuase a friend wanted to go there,  it was subpar at best.  They hire people who don't care, walk around clueless and laxadasical.   I used to love the old location, I won't go back to the new unless someone insists on going.  When there is a problem, it is always becuase of poor management.  Location is great,  service rates a zero and the food is ok. Taco kissi is way better.

This place was very delicious! I got the ranchero burro and it was so good. The plate could feed at least two people. The staff was great and so nice! I also got the fried ice cream it was good. I would recommend this place to all my friends.

This update is to drop La Piñata from 2 stars to one. I had been eating there from the 1970s when I worked nearby. I was sickened to think of all the dollars my family & friends and co-workers spent there over all those many decades when I read a comment on my review by the manager, "Peter B." I clicked his other reviews and found that he'd stooped to putting bad reviews on his competitors. I informed each one of them and one was upset, as he said, "I know the family." I reported this infraction of Yelp's standards to Yelp and they removed his negative comments from the reviews of Peter B.'s competitors. That is sad.

Saw this place on Check Please AZ, noticed that they have moved to a new location so we gave it a try. OMG!! The service was excellent, and the food even better. Everything was fresh and hot. The tacos were amazing and the Yucatan chimichanga was crisp with the cheese sauce smothering it.

Literally everything on the menu is delicious. Great lunch specials during the week and the drinks are strong and refreshing, and pair perfectly with their food. Their patio is dog friendly as long as your furry friend is on a leash and knows how to behave. They are busy every night during the standard dinner rush but it's definitely worth the wait. If you don't want to wait to be sat, go in a bit later and you're guaranteed an amazing experience.

My family's been going to La Pinata for years - like many of the reviewers.  The restaurant inspires loyalty. 

I've eaten a lot of Mexican food at a lot of places in both Phoenix and LA and I have to admit, La Pinata is good, really good.  

We went the other night and I got the green corn tamale, rice, and beans and a Sprite.  The tamale was moist, fluffy, and just a tad sweet - perfect.  I think the trick with good Mexican food must be the quality of ingredients.  Their rice is moist but rich and their beans are creamy with lots of tasty cheese melted on top.  Of course, there's the requisite shredded lettuce and tomato on the side but it always seems fresh and the right amount.  I've also really enjoyed the chili relleno - again quality ingredients - the cheese is well melted in the relleno, it's a good size, and the egg coating is just the right texture.  I usually get that or the green corn tamale.  My mom usually gets either the green or red burrito.  She likes to shake it up like that!

As people have mentioned, the chips and salsa are addictive.  You've got to like your salsa hot because that's what it is there.  

It's a family-owned restaurant and they've been there for years and years so you know they must be doing something right. It's not fancy but it's definitely not a hole in the wall.  There's the requisite pinatas hanging from the ceiling when you walk in and Latin art work on the walls, red booths and dark carpet but the uniforms are just polo shirts and there's no mariachi bands.  

I think if you're looking to get some hearty, tasty Mexican food, you should definitely brave Indian School and give them a try. I think you'll like them.

All hail the Arizona cheese crisp and this instituation that has been around since 1970 still makes a great one.

This most recent trip to Phoenix for the Jewish New Year left me longing to visit my Grandfather's grave along with my Great Aunt Florence and my Great Uncle Marshall. In order to go to the cemetery, we have to go through what is now a "sketchy part of town" but a part that I used to be more familiar with when I was younger. Since we were going on our way to the airport, I suggested to my Mom that we go to LP for lunch so I could get my cheese crisp fix and see if my childhood memories of this place lived up. 

The Synagogue I grew up going to was close to LP. La Pinata was the first "real" Mexican food restaurant I ate at and the only one my Grandparent's would go to since they never really cared for Mexican food but did like cheese crisps and chimichangas. My Great Uncle had his 50th birthday party here in 1976 and I was there. Yes, there is history. 

Most importantly, when we arrived around 2pm on Saturday afternoon, there were mostly empty tables and the decor was the same as I remembered it. Our waiter was super nice, we ordered the cheese crisp and it came out crispy, and piping hot. For those of you who don't know what a cheese crisp is, imagine a giant tortilla topped with cheese then baked or put under a broiler for a few minutes and sliced in triangles like a pizza. It is awesome and something I make at home but it is not quite the same. 

My mom ordered a spinach enchilada a la carte, I had a side of refried (lardy kind) beans and rice and the daughter had the lunch portion of steak fajitas (huge portion). Lunch menu is available M-Sat which is a very nice thing to know. 

Is this the best Mexican food ever? No. Did the taste and my memory hold up? Yes. Will I be back-DEFINITELY! 

Thank you La Pinata for being at least one thing that hasn't changed in Phoenix...

On my way to see pops, had some extra time and had lunch here. I ordered their steak fajitas! Since wife hates this dish!(the smell), and she wasn't with me!!! That's what I ordered! The carne asada steak was awesome, really loved this plate. Comes with beans and rice, both were good. Chips were ok, didn't really liked the salsa. But that's not why I came here for! Great restaurant, will come back again.

Loved it.

I had a salad (boring I know). But it was amazing. Really fresh and delicious cheese (I have no idea what kind however), great guacamole, and a strong and wonderful 3330 margarita. 

The waiters were fairly attentive and the food didn't take too long. I think we were there until their closing time or 9:30 or 10. The restaurant appeared to be very friendly to all types of families. The atmosphere was super comfortable but still had a decor and an appropriate level of mex restaurant ambiance.

The sign out front is the best part though! It's a great place to grab a meal and judging by the margarita probably an ok place to just have chips and drinks too!

I've been going to this restaurant since I was a student at nearby West High School.
It remains my favorite Mexican food in Phoenix to this day.
The recipes are great, food is always consistent and the ownership has remained in the family since inception.
I just wish I could talk the owners into opening in North Scottsdale...it takes me an hour to drive there, but worth the drive.

My parents suggested this centeralized meeting place for lunch today. They have good lunch specials for Mondays-Saturdays. I ordered the red beef chile burro enchilada style. It was a little bit dry so I had to order extra red sauce to make it juicer. This is a favorite for my parents, but I have to give them an average rating for taste. The portions were generous and the service was "ok". Again, my mom enjoyed the salsa and i feel like it needed a little more salt or flavor, like maybe fresh cilantro or lime. Would I recommend this place to my fellow Mexican food connoisseurs? No, I would not.

not only have I ate here several times but also worked here for about a month, I can say that absolutely everything is hand made with the exception of the tortillas. Their vegies are kept fresh in the fridge and there all about how the food looks so if a lettuce leaf is slightly brown guess what? trash time. Kitchen is deep cleaned daily and the kitchen staff is like family to each other. As a customer I love the food and the ambiance is clean and calm it is not over priced as they give good sized portions. All the servers are exceptional.
Absolutely delicious! Great decor, awesome staff. Tamales are the bomb! Yummy margaritas. New favorite Mexican restaurant.

Yelp does it again! We flew in from Austin and San Francisco for the weekend of football games. We wanted to have great Mexican food and we found it at La Piñata.  The atmosphere, service, drinks and food were all delish! The chips were thin and warm, the guacamole was fresh and the margarita divine.  We had shredded beef flautas, beef tamales, chicken tostadas and piñata chimi...all excellent!  The rice and beans were great also.  When in Phoenix again, we will definitely be back!!
Food is good, drinks are good, chips are great, salsa is great. The service however is not all that good, seems like every time I go back service is more neglectful...

Tried to get in here several times and couldn't. Now I see why. It's excellent. I had the salad carbon with marinated steak. My wife had the machada burrito and mh daughter had the black bean tostada. We all loved it. Plenty of food as well. Good atmosphere and service.  A new favorite.  You won't be disappointed unless you can't get in.

La Pinata - the Home of the Chimi since 1970!!  This Phoenix institution is by far my favorite Mexican dive in Phoenix.  This place hasn't changed since the day the doors opened 40 years ago!  The best machaca chimi in Phoenix!
Good food! Great atmosphere! Great patio. Staff was super friendly and accommodating! We will definately return!

I must say that Rose Ann and her
Staff at la piñata out did themselves! We went back and could not be happier with the service and food!   Thank you Rose Ann and Pete for taking care of us and showing that your customers matter!! We love it and will be back!!

Visited there new location for the first time love the new look and plenty of staff to make sure you are well taken care of. The food is great, the location near, the atmosphere friendly and easy going. Will definitely come back

This really is my favorite Mexican food around. Even though I'm mostly veggie, there's plenty of great choices. I love the green corn tamale, the black bean and rice burrito and at lunch they have a yummy black bean tostado with some kind of dressing that is like crack. And the salad with shrimp on it is excellent for the low carbers out there! Also the salsa is consistantly good. You must try their happy hour! Great Margs and Strong!!! Try the 3330 if you like um strong! If you sit in the bar, say Hi to Daniel! He's the best!

We love their food. Was SO bummed to learn the new location no longer does take out, which is what we usually get. The girl on the phone was short and just said "we are dine-in only" as if they'd never done take out and basically hung up on me. This has always been standard phone etiquette at La Piñata but without chicken tortilla soup take out as a result, I was not happy. Nice new digs but no take out, same poor service keeps me at 3 stars.

Opened in 1970, La Piñata, a family affair, has been dishing up Sonora style Mexican food for 39 years. Walking into the restaurant you're immediately transported back to 1970. No time machine required, thanks to dark orange vinyl booths, plastic wood laminate tables and stucco walls. The only element missing were the traditional Mexican dresses. Though it something feels like it wasn't that long ago when those may have been retired. Even in the 70's style, La Piñata is relaxed, like going to a friend's house for dinner. The dark orange vinyl might be original but you can tell this place is loved and well cared for.  Not a strip of duct tape anywhere!

Starting with chips and salsa is almost always pure happiness. Hot and crispy, slightly salty paired with thick chunky salsa, a real bargain at free. Be warned if you think thick and chunky means mild and bland, far from it. On first bite the fresh tomato flavor bursts into your mouth followed quickly by a smack of the spicy chili heat. The 2 contrasts work so well together that it's quite difficult to stop eating until the bowl is empty. Cleverly hidden in the back as to make it more special, is another salsa, this one being almost as spicy and slightly sweet. Many Mexican restaurants have a spicier salsa they keep in back and will only bring out if requested. Ask for this one and your server will happily bring you out a dish.

For lunch La Piñata offers a variety of specials. There's a Taco in My Burro ($4.95) that uses a large flour tortilla, filling it up with ground beef, lettuce, tomatoes, cheese and onions.  Try getting your mouth around this one! Letter F ($8.95) combines a taco of your choice and a cheese enchilada served with rice and beans. The shredded beef taco was decent but it was the cheese enchilada that rocked this plate. The sauce was so wonderfully creamy you couldn't tell where the sauce ended and the melted cheese began.   A dozen of these wouldn't be enough!  A, Taco Salad ($6.50) could be considered a lighter option if the deliciously crunchy shell was missing. Who wants to give up that texture for a few hundred calories? Choice of chicken or beef and topped by large dollops of guacamole and sour cream, pure caloric heaven!   

Aside from the luncheon menu the remainder can be ordered all day. Being a great place to start, the Mary Lou ($8.75), may sound like a retired Olympic gymnast, is actually red or green chile with meat, folded into a humongous cheese crisp served with a cruet full of sour cream. The red chile has a certain creaminess that's further contrasted with thick tender cubes of beef and a spoonful of sour cream, so easy to swallow. Piñata Appetizers ($12.50) comes on a large dinner plate literally filled with miniature tacos, chimichangas, flautas, green corn tamale and a bowl of refried beans for dipping. This is the mother lode of appetizers, easily feeding 2-4 diners or for a larger appetite ordered as a main course. Being able to try so many different items at one time make this the dim sum of Mexican food.

As you can tell the portion sizes at La Piñata are extremely generous. The Tio Pancho's Pollo Con Queso ($11.95) is an entree force to be reckoned with. A deep fried burro stuffed with tender seasoned chicken and smothered in melted jalapeno cream cheese and cheddar cheese. Easily mesmerized by its girth, one bite and you'll know why you ordered it, simply fantastic. The Yucatan ($11.95) is similar in its approach though this time you're given the choice of meats chicken or beef. Once again smothered, this time in their spinach con queso sauce that combines cheese and spinach into each cheesy melty bite, napkins required.

There are also 10 combination plates for the diner who enjoys variety. The number 2 ($10.95) comes with 2 red or green cheese enchiladas with rice and beans. Again the enchiladas here are simply top drawer. Refried beans are generally the norm, but there is nothing normal about how good these taste. These refried beans could easily make up a meal on their own with a bowl of chips and salsa. Or you can wrap your fist around a Bean Burrito ($4.25) and savor each creamy smooth mouthful.

With so much savory and spicy it's nice to know that there are desserts to refresh your palate. The house made Flan ($4.25) is a great way to finish your meal. It isn't possible but the caramel sauce served with the flan would make an excellent dessert soup. Lightly syrupy with a rich buttery taste, if they do start serving bowl of it, you read it first here! Sopapilla with Honey ($2.95) is always a sticky and sweet pleaser. Lightly fried and delicately crisp on the outside, steamy chewiness on the inside all slathered with thick ropes of golden honey, it isn't just dessert but a simple pleasure.

We are blessed to have one another in our busy day to day lives. So it's nice to know that there are such welcoming places, like La Piñata, where we can tear tortillas, eat homemade beans and just enjoy and celebrate.

Decided to take my dad here for a late lunch Friday afternoon. When we were seated they gave us chips and salsa and they were delicious!!! My dad had the Chili Rellenos, I had the bean and cheese burrito with the queso on top, my brother's gf had a combo plate and my brother had the taco in my burrito. It was all OUTSTANDING!!! The service was great too!!!
So nice that this is also only a few minutes from my parents house too! I cannot wait to go back again!

La Pinata has moved and it's for the better!  Their new location is so much nicer than the old location!  Not that I minded the old location, it's just that this new location rocks.  The interior is nice, and they have an even nicer patio to enjoy the last of the remaining temperate days.

The menu is just as good as the old menu; I might have noticed a few changes, but not a lot.  The food is still spot on, just in a more appealing environment.

Check them out, you won't be disappointed!  JM
Good Mexican food, but it is like sitting in a basement (no windows, no ambiance).  Food is solid though.  I would go back if I was in the area, but would not make a special trip.

It's a little bit of a drive for me since I am in north Peoria but oh my god this place is to die for. Seriously worth the drive just for dinner. I am so thankful I was introduced to this place, it's so hard for me to find a DELICIOUS Mexican food place and this just takes the cake!

Really good food the decor is all that but I could care less the owners are usually their walking around. Making sure everyone is satisfied with the service and food. The enchiladas are really tasty and so are the beans and rice I really like this place alot it's good food and friendly service from everyone.

you know what they say  if the Chili Reno is good the rest of the food is awesome    and the Chili Reno was awesome    first time at this place and it has just become my new favorite place... Mexican food is my Favorite   cant wait to bring my family and friennds here     I want to try so many different things    I so cant wait  Ill be back  ASAP  Thank you Owners of this restruant  you are doing amazing    :)

Mexican done right!!!

First time here and a great experience with our server and the food.

The frozen margaritas are phenomenal and a must do in my book!

I had the chicken chimichanga with green sauce!

Yum

I've always loved this place, love their new location on 7th, food is always good. Guacamole is freshly made,  try crispy cheese crisp,  always a good choice.  Flautas    seem to be handmade.  My boyfriend had ranchero machaca burrito,  sucker was huge!

Service was good, Friday night the place was packed. 
I heard one family balk at the 20 min wait and said they were going to Sylvia's across the street! Don't do it, this place worth the wait! I would not eat Sylvia's, not worth it!
Food is fantastic!! Love the pork carnitas! Location is beautiful and friendly staff. Very happy with my experience

Great atmosphere, upscale feel with reasonable prices and excellent service.   Our server, Anthony was outstanding, he made the experience a home run.  The food was good, we had tacos (don't get ground beef, try the chicken or shredded beef).  My wife had a nice chicken breast meal and my daughter enjoyed the tamales, everything we had was good.  The patio was warm despite cold outdoor Temps with a fireplace and great ambiance.   We highly recommend and will be back for sure.

Food was ok, typical Mexican food but I'm not a huge fan of eating high calorie meals loaded with cheese. Lots of it so you better be hungry. 
Service was very good.

Daniel gave us great service with his cute hair. They kept the chips coming I was afraid I'd be to full but when the food came I made room. If I lived in the area I'd be sure to come here more often. I'd suggest you try the chimmy minis BOMB!!!!

Not that the food was bad but the service... my husband and I have been going there since this location opened. Last time we went our experiences wasn't that great. So we hadn't been back in 6 months till today.  Our server was the bartender and we sat in the corner table. 1st he got my husbands order wrong... whatever,  towards the end of the meal I wanted another beer, he never came over, in fact I watched as he talks to a guy sitting at the bar ignoring us and the table next to us, so I went up and ordered my beer, he was quick to bring it out at which time we asked for to go boxes and our check... 15 minutes go by and he's still talking to the same damn guy sitting at the bar... by now I'm pissed. So I start to stand up to go talk to the owner, he sees me, runs over with the boxes, and again I have to ask for the check... I left pissed off and angry ... in my adult life I have never left such a bad tip for service, but ignoring your customers doesn't earn u a big tip. Here's a hit, if u don't have time to wait tables DONT, leave it up to the servers... WE WONT GO BACK

Fantastic food.  This is a great place to eat.  Everything on the menu is consistently delicious.  Service has been stellar during every one of my visits.  Good luck finding a parking space during peak times.
Another superb meal for me and two friends. Same exceptional service. Will be back.
Our neighborhood go to that's within walking distance of home!!! They have Delicious food & margaritas - Absolutely Authentic and We Love It!!!

New location interior is awesome, staff is super friendly and although the menu has not changed much the food does taste slightly better. Parking can be a challenge but I suppose I can park across the street where La CaNasty used to be. Happy hour menu items and drinks are great too.

La Pinata has a kick ass sign!!
The place inside is pretty lack luster and drab.

Margaritas are decent but not as good as some of these rave reviews.
Big portions of food but still kind of over pricey for what it actually is.

Husband has a tasty green tamale, decent cheese enchilada and so-so beef taco.  I got the black bean and rice burrito, big in size, beans very bland.
We got a green chile cheese crisp to start, that was good, they have a good cheese blend.

Our service was fantastic so he got tipped very well.  Good service is hard to come by.

As for Mexican food, Rositas on 22nd and McDowell is still my favorite for food and margs.  Not affiliated with any other Rositas in the valley.

What a great experience. 
A friend and I went in for dinner on 4/12. We ordered drinks, they came with no delay. Chips, food, water refills, "do you need anything?" We are good.  The service was outstanding. It seemed that all the people their cared about us having a good meal with no issues. 

The food was good, drinks good... I'll be back.
Best chimichanga and cheese crisps on the planet! Has been my favorite 'go-to' Mexican since 1972!  Same family owners!  Consistant and good!  Great Margaritas, too!
Really good food.  Enjoyed the fast and friendly service.  Definitely will be back again.  Happy hour every Tuesday, all day!  $3 for the best margarita I had in a long time.
This rating is for the only thing I ever order...it's so good I can't be adventuresome enough to try anything else:  Chicken Azteca!

This place was great!  I wasn't sure what to expect based on such mixed reviews, but we were pleasantly surprised.  Great food, attentive and friendly servers and a nice atmosphere.  We went for an early dinner on a Friday with our kids and sat on the patio and everyone was SO nice.  Best Mexican food we've had in a while and in a great place!  The only negative I can think of is the parking, which can definitely get tight as the restaurant gets more crowded.  Can't wait to go back!

I love the new location!  They made the move from their old location on 19th Avenue and Osborn to the old Mary Coyle building on 7th Avenue and Missouri recently. Glad they moved, the old one had great food but the location was getting a little sketchy. They did a complete renovation of the inside. Nice modern Mexican theme. 

Same great food here at the new one. Excellent service. It was packed when I was here. 


Great chips and salsa to start out. 

I had the green chili quesadilla and albondigas soup for my entree. Both really good. The green chili was hot! My friends had beef chimichangas and said they were excellent.  

I am looking forward to going back here. 

Check out the new location! 

Enjoy!

I was completely blown away by La Pinata Restaurant! I mean I've passed by there tons of times and always thought it was just a bar but boy was I in for a surprise. 
The food was awesome, service was great and the atmosphere was classic Mexican Mission style, complete with Terra cotta floors, paintings and nice tan leather booths that were very shiny. 
I am sure I will visit many times in the future.

Picked up a to go order. Service was quick. A suggestion for whoever is taking orders. If someone asks what is in the beans or rice, what kind of lettuce do you use, this should be known. If not, then find out., not just say ' I don't know 'and stand there like I'm wasting your time. 

Better yet, include these items on the menu for those diners with allergies or sensitivities. 


Roseanne(sp) was very helpful.
So many people have said the positive things that come to my mind about this place too.  This is for sure to become one of my regular spots.

First time having Sonoran style Mexican food.  I took my daughter and she had the chimichanga and I had the carnitas, both dishes absolutely delicious. Our server was helpful in our choices. I look forward to eating here again even though it's not in my neighborhood.
Our family of 5 had an awesome dinner. 5 different meals and every dish was yummy. We were so stuffed when we left.  Our waitress was a sweet older woman that took good care of us.

My favorite!!!!! I frequent La Piñata mostly every week! Their frozen margarita topped with a Chambord Liqueur floater is my go to starter, afterwards I chose their always fresh Modelo Especial on tap! Peter, one of the owners, is a wonderfully great person! ALWAYS have some of the best conversations with him! Super personable and well liked individual, and also one of the MAIN reasons I continue to visit La Piñata over and over again! Definitely would recommend La Piñata to a friend, and will continue to come here again and again!

I love this place! It is easily one of my favorite spots whether it's for happy hour, lunch, or dinner! The service is friendly and attentive, the food is fantastic, and the atmosphere is pretty cool too! I even had my last birthday dinner here and they did a wonderful job. Their patio is dog friendly and shaded which is a nice draw as well. I highly suggest the green corn tamales and the green chili but, honestly, I haven't had anything I didn't like. They have a great cocktail menu too!

Oh, La Piñata. How I loved your old location and how I loathe the new one. Suddenly, a charming old school Mexican food with amazing food, margaritas, and servers turns into a loud, chaotic cafeteria experience with a parking lot far too small to accommodate the droves of people who (thankfully) didn't know about the other location. While the food is still the best Mexican in the city and the margaritas on point, coming here has become more of an annoyance than a joy depending on the day. I'm sure you've gotten a lot of new business, and I'm happy for you for that... but this location stinks!! It has become another loud, trendy Phoenix restaurant restaurant with no unique attributes.
Great atmosphere, very good service, hot food, by far the best red chili meat in town.

I absolutely adore coming to La Pinata. I moved to the central part of Phoenix about six months ago from the west side of town, and at the recommendation of a good friend, came here. It's become one of my favorite places for Mexican food. The service is always great and attentive (I often choose to sit at the bar), and the food is to die for. Do yourself a favor and get the Mary Lou with red chile. Delicious!

Stopped in for a weekday lunch with friends on their suggested.  I wanted local Mexican cuisine and that's what I got.  

We had the cheese crisp, which is like a medium pizza with cheese and hot peppers.  I had the spinach quesadilla with rice and beans and a side salad.  So yummy!  My friends had the seafood quesadilla and beef tacos, each with rice and beans.  You know the food is good when conversation ends and the focus is on your lunch.  

The service was very good and I will go back for sure.
Absolutely love this place. I have been coming here since I was 3 and still havent found a mexican food place I like more. Miss the old building but the foods still good.

I just moved into this area in December 2012 and met "Nita Margarita" out shopping.  She encouraged me to at least try La Pinata because I was looking for that ultimate in Mexican food.  As I drove into the parking lot I was a little skeptical but, once inside, it was quaint, albeit a little too dark.  Using my flashlight app (yes it was that dark), I spotted the guacamole which is my absolute fav.  Our waitress came and took our drink orders and left.  After some time she returned with our drinks and started to take our order.  I asked for a side of guacamole to go with the chips as I cannot eat salsa.  We both ordered and waited...and waited......and waited.  No guacamole, nothing.  The place was not crowded or I would have taken that into consideration.  After about 20 minutes our food arrived so I again requested the guacamole.  About half way through my tostada, the guacamole came but by then we were out of chips.  The tostada was absolutely delicious and, once I did get my guacamole and chips, I enjoyed those as well.  Even though the food was really good, I have been to other good authentic Mexican restaurants that had much better service.  I am generally very postive but this hour long meal just did not set well.

A great old time mexican place!  The food is good and the atmosphere is what you expect for a traditional slightly run down restaurant.  The service is always great and the food is also wonderful.  It is also laid back and good environment for kids.  The parking is sometimes full and the neighborhood not so great, so try to find a space in the small area.

This place is great.  We use to live in the neighborhood near this place and the food is great.  My friend Alexander C., described the restaurant and its interior perfectly.  Dimly lit and cozy.  The food is like a good home cooked meal.  
There are numerous choices on the menu at a decent price. The service is good and the owner wants you to know he expects it to be good. It may be an old restaurant but it is well maintained and clean.  It's a neighborhood eatery locals like, however, it is waiting for newcomers to discover it.

Contemporary setting meets traditional Mexican cuisine. This place is great. The surroundings are "modern Mexican" with a traditional color palette and accessories with an updated urban design. Food was amazing and served in generous portions. The chicken nachos were completely loaded with chicken, cheese, pico, etc... Chimichanga was huge, smothered in sauce, and came with sour cream and guacamole. We had a large party  and the service was fantastic. Al the waiters pitched in together to provide excellent service.

Great service. Delicious Black Bean Tostada. They put the cheese on top of the beans so it melts then it has a full salad on top with lettuce, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, carrots, red and green peppers. With a vinaigrette dressing to give it a great flavor.

Everything was so great, Food , enchilada sauce so tasty, beans great. Service was good nice friendly, Price was just little high. We are from Las Vegas and Will be back mmmm. The only thing is if you bring an infant No changing table in restroom.

Been here at least 10 times.  Never had a bad experience.  Service is amazing and the food is even better.  Possibly the best Mexican restaurant we've been to. We would highly recommend this establishment.

Awesome local spot. Family friendly and cosy, with character. 

Food was pretty good, service was great.

By far the best Mexican food I've had so far.  Their enchiladas rock!  THE BEST MARGARITAS IN TOWN!!!  I never taste the tequila and all I need is one margarita.  I love their chips and salsa.  Their servers are always nice and very attentive.  

Definitely try this place out!

So here is the thing... always give someone a second chance... don't know why I never updated this from a year ago 

I must have been cranky they didn't do takeout. They do now! I've lived in phx my whole life. Hands down some of the best Mexican food around! Try the Yucatán!

Had takeout from here twice and dined-in for the first time last night - so time for a review!

This place has certainly seen the the neighbourhood change since it opened in 1969. While the fabric shop has been replaced by a liquor store and the wig store replaced by Llantera El Rincon Tires and Rims, La Piñata remains constant, serving Sonoran Mexican cuisine and famous for it's Chimichanga. If you are struggling to find La Piñata, it's right across the street from Vlad's Barbershop (who also buys gold)

Service has always been very friendly here with the owner(?) always happy to strike up a conversation about the weather or the utility companies or the state of the nation. The hostesses and the servers are customer orientated too.

In my three visits I've had the Beef Asada Burro, the Chicken Quesadilla and the Shrimp Baja. The first thing worth mentioning is the portion size, absolutely massive! Certainly enough to make a meal again the next day. The burro was packed with heaps of meat, perfectly cooked and seasoned, onions, tomatoes, cilantro - excellent. There are two chicken quesadillas on the menu, Charbroiled or Machacadilla. The charbroiled is only meat, the machacadilla adds veggies. The choice is yours, they are both great. The shrimp for the Shrimp Baja was very good, although it was probably my least favourite of the three dishes and lacked a punch.

Great Mexican beer selection (plus Bud Light if you prefer to drink water!) and although we didn't have one, the margaritas looked amazing. The place is obviously very popular because the restaurant was almost full when we came in around 6pm and the tables turned while we were there.

...weaned me off baby food with rice and beans.

I've been going to the Pinata since before I could walk. My grandparents were tight with the Bougarins and we ate there often. At some point (as my grandmother tells us every time we go), Pete confronted my mother and told her I shouldn't be eating that baby food, that I should be getting a proper start with an order of rice and beans. After that, I was hooked. For years I ordered the same thing with a Roy Roger (think cherry coke). Family Wedding rehearsal dinners, birthdays, out of town guests, there seemed to be no reason not to choose the Pinata for good Mexican food.

I used to sneak away from the table to play video games in the front corner of the cantina. Even today, it still feels like a room that I shouldn't be in or even curious about. Each time, our going-away treat was one of the $0.05 chocolate mints from the bowl on the host stand -- they are still selling the very same mints!

This place is more nostalgic for me than anything else. I have so many memories of so many family occasions celebrated there. The lobby is still decorated with colorful pinatas hanging from the ceiling and walls. Mariachi music still fills the air. And the blender can still be heard in the distance, chopping fresh ice for the next margarita.

As Amy already correctly identified, this is the best chips and salsa in town. On recent visits the salsa has been watery, but it could easily have been that spoonful from the big container of it back in the kitchen. Speaking of which, above the kitchen entrance is an old 1-10 lighted number display to alert the wait staff of orders ready to be served. I used to ask the waitress what her number was and watch for it. (Not much else to do when surrounded by adult-talk.)

If our guests were lingering types, we often ended up at the 31-flavors ice cream next door. It lost its franchise many years ago, no doubt caught by the inspector selling generic from the Price Club like so many other former franchises in this old chain. Today this store is just a City signs violation, like something out of Tijuana.

But back to the Pinata. It's one of the valley originals. If you haven't done it, and you think you are a Phoenician, you aren't one yet.

This restaurant is crazy good. It's classic Mexican food with really high quality ingredients and a clear attention to detail by the chef. The plates come out piping hot, the refried beans are incredible, the cheese is real cheese, the lettuce and tomato garnish is so fresh... the salsa tastes like a grandma made it after years and years of experimenting with recipes... resulting in the most delicious salsa that is not too spicy but spicy enough. 

The restaurant is also decorated beautifully. Not sure if it was custom designed, or was an effort by the owner - but it turned out gorgeous. No matter what time of day you go there, it feels like an intimate night time dinner in another place. Even the women's bathroom is designed beautifully (I love checking out restaurant bathroom design..)

Definitely a great date night spot as the food is delightful and the ambiance is spot on. A locally owned gem.

Ok, so went to the new location on 7th avenue - against my will. My friends wanted to go (I just planned on eating very little and then making a sandwich when I got home). To my surprise, the interior was really cute with lots of windows and I decided to go ahead and give this place another chance. I'm really glad I did. The food was surprisingly good. I ordered my typical go to Mexican combo, cheese enchilada and beef taco with rice and beans. Everything tasted fresh and gone was that nasty cheese from my prior visit. I have been to this new location twice so far and both times the food was great. I recommend.

First impression was great thanks to the man that welcomed us into the restaurant, we got seated immediately. They have a very fun environment and modern fixtures. LOVE the outside patio lighting. Atmosphere is extremely pleasant. Booth seat isn't too worn in and still bouncy! 

Got the #1- Enchiladas were delicious and served on a hot plate, had enough for leftovers, and would order again. 
Margarita was 95% tequila-AKA fantastic and forced me to take an uber home. One tequila, two tequila, three tequila, uber... Ya feel? ;) 

One negative experience was the waitress. she was not very friendly and never asked if we wanted drinks or appetizers. Ran away to the back with our IDs when we ordered a drink. Had to request through other employees to make orders and get her to the table. Never introduced herself.

In short, I enjoyed the atmosphere and food, we will be back again! Thank you!

PS please make taco Tuesday deals all day versus during happy hour times.

We have been 3-4 times since the new location opened on 7th Ave, north of Missouri. I have had a shredded beef chimichanga, Green Chile Burrito, Bean Burrito - red enchilada style.

Of the three entrees, the bean burrito enchilada style was the best. Their enchilada sauce is pretty good. Their salsa is decent and the service was quick. I am glad this spot opened up because the neighborhood could use a good sonoran style mexican food restaurant.

We had a nice first experience at La Piñata tonight. We can in with time to try some things off the happy hour menu including the machaca street tacos, the house margarita and a beer. The tacos was piled high with delicious and fresh ingredients and were my favorite of everything we tried. It comes with a verde sauce that is to die for. My husband ordered the combo #4 which came with a red chili burro, crunchy taco, and tostada. We added a side of rice to try as well. He really liked his dish, especially the tostada. Our server Reese was very helpful, friendly, and quick. Based on the food, nice and clean atmosphere, and amazing customer service experience we will be back again soon!

I guess no place can get it 100%. It is crowded and we've always had to wait. No big deal for the right place. We like the patio though the fake grass wall is weird. Like many others I suppose, we have a favorite place for one dish and another place for another dish. We've only been there twice, each time we were a party of four so we tried several different dishes. Their cheese crisp is standard (not as good as Los Compadres if you like a really crispy tortilla which we do), tacos were just okay, the enchiladas were a bit better, the salsa was ordinary, beans seemed canned and the tamales were downright boring. The best dishes we had were the Pollo Azteca and the Pork Carnitas. We'll probably go back occassionally for those since they are walking distance from our house but when we want really good Mexican food, this is not our place.
The salsa is amazing. We ear out alot and this salsa is great. Love this place,nice atmosphere as well. Highly recommend
Always eat to much.  Mexican food and beer that can't  beat. Anything with the grilled steak or chicken  is delicious.   Busy but staff is always friendly and check  up on you.

This place was fantastic! We're from SD and was just browsing and saw the clever name, gave it a chance and was blown away by the amazing food, proportions, decor and cleanliness of it all. One of my new top 5 Mexican restaurants! Definitely recommend!

Some of the best Mexican food I've had in a long time. The pork carnitas and the shredded beef are astounding. So are the tacos and the enchiladas. We loved every bite! The guacamole is thick and fresh and plentiful along with the house made salsa and black beans. Can't wait to come back!

Even though it was busy the service was quick and kind and we had everything within moments.

The new location is very nice but a lot smaller than the old location. The open dining room makes it very noisy at times. Chips were hot and fresh, salsa and hot sauce was tasty. The food came out in a timely manner served hot. The green chili chimichanga was good. Meat was nice and tender. Just wish they put more of it in the chimichanga. I felt I was getting a lot of tortilla per bite. Matthew was our server and he was awesome! Very attentive and checked on us regularly without hovering. Thank you Matthew for making our dinner experience even better.

We stopped by on Saturday after going to the Burton Barr library.  My mom actually used to visit this place regularly when she was pregnant with me, she reports it's just as good now!  I was pleasently surprised to see the garden fajitas on the menu, they're so delicious.  They're made up of potatos, carrots, bell peppers, mushrooms, and onions also served with the usual, beans (not sure they're vegetarian, didn't eat them and didn't ask), rice, guacamole, and sour cream.  They were very yummy, they also have spinach enchiladas and a black bean and rice burro for the veggies.
My mom had the seafood enchiladas, she raved about them, and my husband enjoyed the chicken fajitas which even at a lunch portion were huge.  

Service was pretty good, atmosphere is nice, for being around 41 years they've kept it up well.  We'll be back when we're in the area.

Jose the waiter hands down understands customer service even with a one time bad experience here at La Piñata. However, I beg to differ on behalf of the co-owner Ramona. After submitting a complaint to avoid future "complaints" about a stale taco ($3.95) she became abrupt stating you ate 3/4 of it. Agreeing to her rebuttal, I clarified I'm still paying for it. I don't want to exchange I'm simply telling you it was stale she continued to argue. My husband then interjected "it was stale" then she reprieved, no apology, no acknowledgement. 

Customer service goes a long way especially when restaurants like Oaxaca's closes down because of the economy as I just found out. Thank-you Jose for apologizing because of your courtesy I still give the restaurant three stars and recommend the food!

Very rude management!!!!! Discriminates against the gay community. Will make you wait longer for a table if you are a member of the gay community. When management was asked about this practice their response was "we'll work on it".

Very rude management!!!!! Discriminates against the gay community. Will make you wait longer for a table if you are a member of the gay community. When management was asked about this practice their response was "we'll work on it".

Came to the new location (have been to the old one over a dozen times) for my Mom's Birthday because this is her favorite restaurant. The new place is really nice but I miss the old charm of the old building and décor. Our server was really nice, just took a while to clear plates etc. but they were extremely busy....I know why....because this place is amazing!! From the queso dip to the shredded chicken tacos to the Mary Lou (OMG!!) everything is excellent. I got a Devil Horn Margarita that was really good too. Their hot sauce and salsa are excellent and the complimentary sopapillas for my Mom's birthday were great.

Our server was really on point with the happy hour specials which really came in to great use.

We will be back for sure. Loved everything :)

PS...GET THE MARY LOU!!! Both green and red are absolutely phenomenal. This is a quesadilla filled with either red chile or green chile and it is stuffed and huge and did I mention AMAZING???!!! Spinach dip is a must too :)

Arrived 20 minutes before closing, and the door was locked. Called and was told the restaurant was closed for the night. 

Will update review when I actually am allowed to eat.

Great neighborhood Mexican joint.   Tasty selections, solid food.  In the old Mary Coyle location on 7th Ave.  Love the chimis, appy sampler platter.   Good selection of Mexican beers.
Recommended.

Warning: the food and service is still wonderful. HOWEVER, without telling us, they added an 18% tip to our check. We only had 6 people in our party. Plus the tip was AFTER taxes. 

This is super annoying as we only noticed through careful review of the bill. The credit slip still had a place for a tip. 

This left a really bad taste in our mouths.

Delicious food, nice ambiance and great service! My family and I have been here twice since their new relocation. What an improvement from the old building they used to be in. On our most recent visit I ordered the beef mini chimis. It would be great if there was an option to have them available 1/2 chicken and the other 1/2 beef. Nonetheless they were delicious and the cream cheese dip is out of this world! Their refried beans and rice are authentic and delicious. The prices are moderate and affordable. I look forward to my next visit to try a margarita.

Deliciousness - 3/5 
Happiness - 3/5

The inside definitely doesn't match the outside. It is very swanky and cool, with an impressive-looking bar in the middle.

We went with a big group. Thus, we got a wide range of food - none of it bad, but plenty of it was mediocre. The chimichangas are darn-near-perfect. Too many places lack the crunch a chimi should have. They have managed to maintain the crunchy taste while still loading it with cheese and sauce. The machaca meat was also pretty good, as were the tacos. We ordered guacamole as and appetizer and a few different types of margaritas, none of which were particularly memorable. The waiter was attentive, but over-sold the spice level of the food (I found very few things to be spicy. In fact, I was piling on the pre-meal salsa to my burrito to get the needed kick!). A lot of the dinner entrees also require extra for rice and beans. That said, the entrees are so big and hearty, virtually none of us finished our complete meals (including the heavy eaters in our group!). 

Also, I love tamales, but don't eat pork. Sadly, this disqualifies many a tamale place and La Pinata joins the group (they do have a green corn tamale too, but I simply don't like green corn ones). 

The kids meal is too expensive at six dollars, and also overloaded with beans and rice. 

The bottom line is it's nice food with big portions. The price is also very reasonable (other than the kids meals). It's definitely not the best Mexican I have had in Phoenix, but it has more than enough unique menu items to make it good to go into any good Mexican rotation.

The biggest problem I had with this place is we asked the waitress to split the bill in half.... It was about fifty bucks and an even number. And she ran my card at $30 and my friends card at $15 and said she "didn't know how" to split it. She could have asked before running our cards. Or taken a calculated and divided by 2? Idk. Pretty annoying. Other than that they do have big portions of food and some stuff is good some stuff is okay. I wouldn't recommend the steak taquitos as they are very bland and over cooked. The tio fundido chimichanga is really good though. This place is okay...

We have been going to La Piñata for over 3 years now... Wait I meant 3 months now! Where have we been? Oh yeah we lived in Scottsdale. Now we live on the west side right up the street from La Piñata and that's the best part! The first time we checked it out we were hooked! 

Waiters and staff are friendly. Decor seems ok to me. piñatas hanging from the ceiling makes sense. But it's the food! Just the right amount of spices. Tastes fresh. I love the chimichangas. Shredded beef is awesome. My wife is the picky one though about her Mexican food. Big thumbs up from her too. She cannot decide what she likes best so she gets the combination with enchilada, tamale and a taco! Her only critique is she thinks the bean burros are pricey. But it's so good!

Now for our daughter's review who only likes bean and cheese burros. "These are the best I've ever had! From now on when we get take-out this is all I want!"
Her review should mean a lot... Like getting 5 stars from Wolfgang Puck! 

So glad we have La Piñata so close to us and look forward to eating there three times a month for the next three years! (After 3 years I am sure we'll move again).

Great, authentic Mexican food.. I have never been disappointed with the food or the service!! My wife is a native of Phoenix and they have been going there since the 70's, and still look forward to their wonderful food.. Great combos, incredible refried beans, etc...

La Pinata has some of the best tacos in town. These are not the ever so trendy street tacos, these are your big fat loaded crispy tacos. The shredded beef is my favorite.

I've also tried the carne quesadilla and it was packed full of flavor and dripping with cheese. 
Parking can be a pain, but it is worth circling the parking lot for the salsa and hot sauce!!

I went to La Pinata when it originally opened but I didn't remember the food and service being so outstanding.

Nestled away in the the eclectic Melrose area. La Pinata really stands out. The decor is modern with a neutral pallete, but they still have traditional Mexican flare sprinkled in to add some culture. Like the three Dia Dos Los Muertos musicians pictured.

The bartender was incredibly friendly. She kept checking in on us, and was always at hand for refills. I also think it was a nice touch when she brought plastic ramekins for our to go food. The margaritas she served were great. They weren't too sweet. You could taste the tequila and skip the heartburn. She also made us beer backs since we like to create our own Beer-rita.

The food was awesome! Their salsa is chunky, and has just the right amount of kick to it. If you need more heat they also have the hot stuff on deck. The shredded chicken in my enchilada and taco was tender and juicy. The enchilada also had green chiles and salsa that made my mouth sing. I'm so over one ingredient enchiladas. The beans were rich and creamy, and the taco was packed with flavorful toppings. Loved every bite!

What a wonderful time we had! My sisters and cousins and myself went to celebrate a couple of birthdays! everybody loved  there food, the wait staff was excellent! The place was decorated so beautifully! The patio looked gorgeous, they had a fire going! We'll definitely be back!

So third visit. Last week. Decided to just stop in for some margaritas at the bar. ( Thur nite)
Sat down. It was only 8:30pm. 
We weren't even acknowledged. I mean.... no hello.... nothing. There were only 4 others at the bar. Not a lot of tables occupied. 
Finally I got the gentleman's attention. Yes.... we would like 2 margaritas please. 
Oh.... okay. ( like why do you think we are here)?
Put them down. A young lady went to hand us menus. No thanks... we are just having drinks. 
You would think we did something wrong once we weren't eating 
That was it.... never addressed us again. We easily could have had another one.... but no thanks. I'll go someone else. 
I mean.... $20 for 2 drinks.... you could have made a killing on us. 
There are people that eat and drink water only! 
We normally do both!! 
I hate to say it.... but I think we are done with LaPinata. Too bad. 
I don't expect a red carpet..... but a simple acknowledgement would be swell.

3 or 4... 3 or 4.. 3 or 4.. ARG! Darn this thing for not having fractions. I knew this would be tough the minute I left this place. 

I find myself in food ruts very often. I know that if I want Mexican food I can go to "insert location here" and leave a happy. Lately my life runs in big giant loops. I do the same things at the same times on the same days. I've decided I need to branch somehow and food is what I landed on. Its a risky one because I don't get to indulge frequently. More often then not its a risk worth taking :)

I decided there had to be other really good old school Arizona Senoran Mexican food joints. This is phoenix, the birth place of the burning hot plate, molten cheese pooling, greasy FREAKING AWESOME! I stumbled upon la pinata.. "Home of the chimichanga since 1970" now that's old school. I did what I always do when I run into something that claims to have been around since the dawn of time in phoenix. I emailed my Dad and Uncle and asked them about it. The whole family loves Mexican and if its been around and was decent they had to have been here.

"Been around forever.. used to go there a few times a week.. don't make it to that area much anymore.."

This is a good sign. I gathered a small group and got it in my mind that I was going to try one of each of the staples:
cheese crisp, guacamole, taco, enchilada, relleno, tamale

We would go here and split this then head over to Los Compadres and do the same. Never made it to #2 as the cheese and grease (not complaining) won over my will to continue.

Food:

chips hot/mild salsa:
The chips were great! Nice and crispy.. no hint of stale or greasy. Really the perfect chip in my mind. The salsa was also delicious. Was very fresh and heavy on the cilantro. It actually had some kick/spice to it. I was actually surprised how much heat it had and that most of the gringo's weren't complaining about it. For me nothing is to hot. Also really liked their hot sauce which was the normal pureed red chili, garlic, Mexican oregano variety but had no bitterness. Good stuff!

cheese crisp:
Ahhhh the cheese crisp. A magical thing made or two ingredients that somehow can be worlds different everywhere you go. This one was great! The cheese blend was excellent. It was the right combination of crispy/fold-able. Some people like them super crunchy.. I'm not one of those people. I like it right in the middle. Fold-ability is important for mass salsa, guacamole storage :) If its to crispy it just crumbles and you have salsa and grease all over your hands, plate and face. It is kind of sexy for a foodie. But you don't want a date seeing you like this. Some places really mess these up.. or even worse! fold the damn things over and still call them cheese crisps.. This is a quesadilla! not the same thing. You serve me a quesadilla when I order a cheese crisp and there's gonna be trouble.

guacamole:
Another place in the valley that knows what guacamole should be. Avocado, Lime, Lemon, Garlic, Green Onion, and Salt. Maybe a little cilantro and some small amount of pepper(serrano) for heat. None of this giant pieces of tomato and white onion nonsense. Some people love it when they ruin guac like this "oh it tastes so fresh!" Bad news people it makes it taste like tomatoes and onions, nothing but a filer knocking down the production cost which I assure you is not passed down to you ;)

shredded beef taco:
I actually like this one better then carlos o'briens. The meat is still very tasty and I believe the shell is fried with the meat inside. It had zero "soggy effect," You know what I'm taking about, one or two bites before the bottom falls out and you finish it on your plate with a fork and knife. Its still tasty when this happens, its kind of like the cheese crisp mess, its not pretty. This was darn good but I still like the ones at Manuels better.

green corn tamale:
I can't judge this well as I don't eat these very often. It was nice and moist and had a good texture. It seemed like it might be a little overly sweet to me.

chile relleno: 
Decent. I liked the batter but the chile was to mild and their green sauce is lacking. Best ones I've ever had were at a place called the friendly dolphin in rocky point Mexico.

cheese enchilada:
I really like their cheese blend so it was hard not to like the enchilada. The corn tortilla was good. Was not a fan of the red sauce.

Red/Green Sauce:
I wasn't in love with the red or the green sauce. It wasn't horrible but far far farrrr from the best in the valley. Since this covers 90% of all Mexican food this is why this place isn't getting a higher rating.

Cons:
Very pricey! a taco, tamale, enchilada, rice and beans combo is 12.95. Cheese crisp with a side of guacamole 7.50!

Service was 3 out of 5. Felt neglected at times.

I was excited to place a carry out order after looking over the menu. We made our choices and called.  To our surprise, they refused to take my order and stated that they do not provide take out service - he stated they are dine in only.  What an odd decision for a restaurant to refuse extra customers without taking up a table.  It's a shame, but with all the Mexican restaurants to choose from, I'm not sure I will choose to dine in at this restaurant in the future.

I just tried to make a reservation for 15 people in March at 11 am on a Tuesday and was informed by a very rude female.  She said "we do not take reservations" and I asked if they would for 15 people and she said " I told you we don't take reservations" and hung up on me.  Is that the way you run a business?  Very poor customer service and I have no intentions of ever coming there or recommending it to my friends.
Our new favorite neighborhood Mexican spot! The green corn tamales and flautas were fantastic! The chips and salsa were fresh and excellent. Great job La Piñata! We'll see you again soon.
I have been coming here since I was in high school in the 70's. The food is still the same good quality and good tasting, the cheese crisp is the bomb!!!!

If you've been or have lived in Phoenix for a while, you know that we have a lot of authentic Mexican restaurants. La Pinata, hands down, has one of the best Mexican dishes I've had in the valley! We ordered the chicken burrito with rice and beans on the side, and a bowl of chicken tortilla soup. Everything came out sizzling hot, fresh, and absolutely delicious. The service, although it was a busy Sunday night, was also on point.

The free chips and salsa were great. Since it was busy, we waited for about 10-15 mins for a party of two. However, once we were seated, our server was very attentive & took our orders right away. There is a small parking surrounding the restaurant. I haven't tried the drinks yet since there is a bar, but I will definitely be back!
This is one of most favorite places to eat in Phoenix.  Highly recommend going here. The staff is always friendly, food always taste great, atmosphere is wonderful.
One of my favorite sit down Mexican restaurants in Phoenix. Always friendly staff. The spinach queso is delicious!

Okay, so this location is new but the food is AMAZING. Being Mexican I know good Mexican food and this is what I compare all Mexican food against now. I've been going to La Piñata since I was a kid, and my parents used to go since they were in high school. The owner uses his mothers recipes and they are to die for. You will not be disappointed with the food or service here, guaranteed.
Steak fajitas are amazing and by far the best in town!  I am definitely a fan of the old location,  loved the old school feel to it.

I had moved out of state and had not been to La Pinata for over 30 years.  I now know why I remembered this Restaurant after all these years.  I ordered the combo with green chilli burrito, taco and tostado.  Everything was excellent.  The green burro was filled with tasted seasoned chunks of beef.  The shredded beef in the taco also was deliciously seasoned.  This is the type of Mexican food that I loved when growing up in Arizona!  I can't wait to go back again.

viva la piñata!! I suppose I have to thank the Spanish conquering of the Aztec empire which paved the way for this Gem of a restaurant. These brave restauranteurs  have started a revolution in my mouth! 

Go here and you won't  be disappointed! 

Service: 10
Food: 10
Ambiance: 10

This is absolutely the Valleys best Mexican food ever!!! The Chili Relleno is cooked to perfection with authentic white cheese! The beans and rice are the best I've ever ever had!! SO Delicious!! The bowl of Green Chili, again, is amazing!!
And now I am on a mission to try everything on the menu. We have The YuccaTan Burrito  today... Yep, so good. 
And the soft cheese crisp with tons of cheese. Tasty! 
Service is always the best and fast!!

We were in the neighborhood and saw it had great reviews. We stopped in and we were blown away with flavor. 
We had the chicken quesadilla and the taco, tamale, and enchilada combo. A sweet older lady thats been coming here for years recommended the tamale and enchilada to me and I'm a glad I ordered it. Best Mexican food! We will be making the trip from chandler more frequently and the owner was especially sweet as well.
With all the different Mexican restaraunts, La Piniata rates very high.  The guacamole is excellent, the service fantastic, and Angilo was an excellent server.
The taco I had tasted like sawdust and enchilada wasn't much better. Sat at the bar and the bar tender never even asked how are meal was. We will never go back

No horchata and no menudo???? What kinda Mexican restaurant is this? If id known that I would of went somewhere else. This place use to be one of my favorites here in Phoenix but the last couple times I have been here the service and food has gone down. Il give it one more time and we will see.

Wow. This placed just opened and I will definitely be back. 
The waiters were so friendly and eager to please. 
The decor was beautifully done and fresh feeling with a traditional Mexican vibe. 

Now... Let's talk food. Absolutely classic and authentic Mexican food. It was fresh and high quality. And...delicious. The tamales were the best I've ever tasted. Everyone at our table enjoyed their food. My husband had the chile relleno and loved it. They have a great bar too!! The margarita was the perfect addition to my dinner. 

Keep it up, La Piñata!! Can't wait for my next visit!

We really like La Pinata. It's in a lousy neighborhood near my office. We found this place a couple of months ago and have probably been back 6 times. We've never had anything that wasn't great or a day with poor service. My favorite is the spinach enchilada but we've tasted about everything on the lunch specials menu and loved it all.
UNbelievable experience.  The food was SOO good and the service was outstanding.  Everyone who worked there was SO nice and genuine!

Seriously good! Excellent service! I rate Mexican food on the basics....salsa, rice and beans. I figure if they can't do that right then there is a problem! Salsa was chunky (like I like) and flavorful. Beans and rice were delicious!  I got a cheese enchilada and beef taco. Beef was juicy and very good! Love their red sauce on the enchilada. Ordered the house margarita on the rocks! Very tasty!  I will definitely be back! Need to sit on the patio before it gets too hot!

Well was very disappointed to see out favorite ice cream parlor closed but delightfully surprised at how much we like this spot!!
Service was FANTASTIC TOP notch!! 
Taco was great lots of cheese. Freshly deep fried shell not like SO MANY Phoenix mex restaurants use!  Enchilada was very good. My wife really enjoyed her chimichanga.  My moms chilli reanno was great too.  Everything we had so far was great.  We will return. Highly recommended.
The tamales were excellent. I also had the chicken chimichanga, it was huge and delicious. And for dessert I couldn't get enough of the sopapillas with honey.

Saturday I decided instead of waiting for bulk pickup I'd make a journey out of disposing my old dishwasher. A trip to a metal recycling center on 19th ave put $5.10 in my pocket to go towards lunch. I short trip north put me right where I wanted to be. Mexican grocery store and strange Catholic/holistic medicine shop on one side of the street, and an eclectic overly decorated Mexican Restaurant next to a auto shop on the other side of the street. 
La Pinata's food was well seasoned, without being overly salty, good chunky homemade salsa, and great prices with very generous portions. The "there's a taco in my burro" with Machaca dry beef was very good, a mildly spicy smokey flavor, and enough for 2 meals. 
Places like this are what make living in the Phoenix area fun!

All of the positive reviews for this place is legit. I came here right before flying out of Phoenix; definitely in the top 3 Mexican restaurants that I have ever been to. Food was extremely flavorful and the portion was big from what I remember.

My coworker took me here for lunch a couple of months ago and it's now my favorite Mexican restaurant in the area.  I absolutely love the enchilada sauce that they have.  I've only gone for lunch, but the portions are large for a lunch menu- I cannot clear my plate.

I've been going to the old location since I was young and the food has never let me down! Went to the new location tonight and was so impressed!! Clean, bright, contemporary!
