I loved seeing the old faces in a new, bright place. They have the same food and the same love goes into that food. Recommend their combos to try a bunch of stuff at once, but also really love their chimichanga, fajitas and enchiladas. Old school Mexican - fatty, full plates!

My family and I come to this restaurant at least once a week. This place has excellent service and you can always count on a consistent and authentic Mexican meal. If you are eating here for the first time I recommend the red Chile dinner plate or the red Mary Lou.

Came into town to visit my mom and had a craving for Mexican food (I'm 7 months pregnant). My mom told us she usually goes to Sylvia's across the street, but I wanted to try La Piñata since it was a new spot. Our server was Daniel and he was so sweet and very easy to talk to. The food was so good! I had the create your own burro and the red sauce is divine. My husband got the mini chimichangas and loved them. Daniel kept coming back to check on us, fill up our waters and spark up some small talk. My husband and mom ordered margaritas and I was so jealous because they looked so good. This is definitely a new and upcoming place in Phx. We are in town for a few more days and will definitely be coming back before we leave!
Food was excellent! I ordered the steak fajitas which were delicious.  Salsa was great, not too spicy.  Beans and rice were tasty. Service was great. Check this place out!

I can't get enough of this place. This is the same La Piñata from years before, but the new location is gorgeous. I'm one of those people who always orders the same thing when I go out, but when I try something here, it's always a winner... the Machacadilla is my new religion.
The bar here is worth the trip alone. The 3330 is the best margarita I've ever had. Honestly. And the Mis Padres margarita swirled with chambord is also aces.

I would never have imagined having quality Mexican food outside of my native Austin, TX, but La Piñata delivers in every category. The decor and ambiance has an authentic, old-school Mexican vibe. The staff are friendly and family oriented. And the food and drinks are truly second to none.
I enjoyed the 3330 and the Copa de Oro margaritas. Both drinks were perfectly balanced in taste, and were not short on spirit.
The Chimichanga (the family's famous original) was well executed to say the least. The tortilla was fluffy and crispy, and the machaca filling was spicy and flavorful.
La Piñata is first rate Mexican food. I can't wait to come back to Phoenix for another visit!
Legit street tacos. Decent margarita. Good guac. Bland salsa. Super excitable server which beats the alternative.
The food is decent considering the degree of competition in Phoenix.  The service, however, is fantastic.  Great people, great place.
Awesome margaritas. Awesome chips and salsa. Great cantina atmosphere. Highly recommend.
Best cheese crisp ever seriously. They win. Enchiladas, tacos, salsa, fried ice cream, hot sauce, and bean burros are all excellent! Love when we do family celebrations because we go to La piñata!!

Okay seriously.... my ultimate favorite place for Mexican food! On this visit I strayed away from my usual "La Piñata" chimi. Wanting to try something new, I got the steak fajitas. I was nervous for the change but when I had my first bite, wow! The flavor combinations were out of this world and I was not disappointed! Now I have a second favorite dish here & I'm excited to try something else next time!

Excellent authentic Mexican cuisine.  Loved the chicken tacos and tamales the most.  Very comfortable dining room.  Our waiter (Jose N.) was attentive, friendly and terrific.  Give this place a try - you will enjoy the food and drinks.

La piñata and I go back 20+ years. I was faster and leaner and dark family Mexican places with great Sonoran food and Frozen Margaritas with freshly fried chips and chunky salsa was just the ticket on the west side. I'm older and not so lean anymore and so is La Piñata. They still have good "gringo" food and I still like it. It's hard to say whether La Piñata and I are worn out or just comfortable, but I'm going to keep coming

Trying the new location out and still great service, menu has many to choose from, and food.... Delicious! The staff are very attentive, and yummy chips and salsa never run out. I would def want to come back and try something else on their menu. So far my fave Mexican restaurant in the valley! Highly recommend!

Came here on cinco de mayo and it was a packed house! Even though it was, the wait for food was not bad at all and you always had chips and salsa and margaritas filled while you wait. With cheap prices you consider quality over quantity but with this restaurant, it wins both!!! As much as I want to keep this place a secret... I highly recommend for others to try it out. The secrets out!!

Hugely disappointed in this new restaurant on 7th Ave after I'd heard a little buzz about it. Although they have seafood throughout the menu, we were informed they don't serve seafood because they have too small a kitchen to handle it. Ordered veggie quesadillas (which the server said were excellent) only to be told later they've removed it from the menu. They offer beef and chicken fajitas but can't hold it and call it veggie? Asked for fajita vegetables on the side which turned out to be a dish of sautéed onions. These guys are in one of the hottest areas for new restaurants in the city, so they better get it together if they're going to survive. By the way, the space is beautifully decorated. Perhaps they should've diverted more thought to the menu for non-meat eaters and (apparently) the kitchen size.
YEsss! This place rules, with a vintage low key old-school Phoenix vibe. The food was ok; the atmosphere is better. Love the mosaic tiles in the front room.

Yum. Every time so good. I've been going here for 15 years, since they were at the 19th ave location, and plan to go for the next 15+ years. Best hot sauce and chicken tacos (among other things) in town.
Service was outstanding and the food was delicious. The enchiladas and tacos are phenomenal. Would recommend a visit!
My go to Mexican food in Phoenix. Traditional Mexican is my favorite and that is exactly what they serve up. Great tacos, nachoa, quesadillas, rice and beans. And of course Modela on tap.

Ugly decor BUT fantastic food. We didn't eat any decor so I suppose it doesn't matter  that much. 
Every time we past this place it seemed that it was ALWAYS packed. We decided we wanted in, so we stopped by for dinner.  
It was a bit pricier that we expected. (And by we I mean myself and my boy toy, aka the hubs.) We soon discovered you pay for the amount of eats you receive. 

Service was great, waiters attentive. Food came out pretty quickly so no complaints there. Once the food was on our table did we realize that you do get a lot. And by a lot I mean we could both have finished one plate and been satisfied.  We ended up having our dinner for lunch the next day so it worked out. I had the Tio Panchos pollo con queso. It was delicious and very flavorful. I can't remember what my guy had as I pay no attention to him when I eat, but I do recall that he enjoyed it very much.

The bathroom wasn't the cleanest I have encountered in a restaurant but I didn't eat in there so it doesn't matter much. 

We will be going back when a craving hits for Mexican food.

The new location of La Pinata is really nice... not sure why it took me so long to visit. The husband and I went to La pinata before I hopped on a plane out of town. The food was tasty and not terribly expensive (though pricier than some 'americanized' Mexican food restaurants). I had the fajita chicken burrito and he had the bean and cheese burrito. He raved about his burrito. Mine was fresh and flavorful.... maybe not rave worthy, but good. I will definitely be putting La Pinata into my Mexican food rotation. 


PS they have hh here and the bar looks quite nice.

Ok, seriously, this place is awesome. The food is really good, the service is consistently excellent, and they make a solid margarita. I've been to this spot several times and it never disappoints. Their burritos are really good... You won't miss on this place and when the weather is nice they have a nice patio too.

Nice place for some good Mexican food. They have a nice selection of Margaritas as well. Sometimes there can be a wait and rates minus one start for the service we had a couple times, felt like our waiter forgot we existed and we waited for 30 min to get the check. But generally service is good.

Very fast and friendly service! Salsa was delicious! Ordered the Charbroiled Steak Quesadilla and they knocked it out of the park, huge serving for an appetizer! Guacamole was great, chunky and fresh! Chicken fajitas were enough for two people. Happy hour drink menu was excellent! Very swanky decor and clean on the insane with no annoyingly, loud music. Bar area is really cool and modern! Great place to go with anyone. Will definitely be back!

This place has been around for years and has the best Mexican in town. My family and I have been probably been coming here for 30 years!!!!  The MP-1 Green corn tamale rice and beans is very good along with their fajitas. Bomb chips and salsa as well!!!

We ate at the old location often...the new location is great! Food and service was amazing and very fast.  One of our favorite Mexican stops in the Valley..cant wait to come back..dang rice is sooo good!!

This is the same great Phoenix staple relocated a little uptown. The resteraunt is smaller then the previous Osborne location but the interior got a great revamp.  EVERYTHING is A-Mazing here.  If you like chicken the tacos are great and is your a little more adventurous the Tio Pancho Pollo Connie Queso is peeeeerfect. The Ranchero burro is fabulous.  All of the staff are very friendly and many have been with this ace for years.  Support a family owned Phoenix tradition.
Cheese crips, queso and Machaca Beef Yucatan were amaxing. Perfect way to end 3 weeks on the road...yumm

Our family has been enjoying eating at La Pinata for more than 40 years.  The new location is wonderful, and the food is, as usual, fabulous.  From the thin, warm chips with the incomparable salsas, to the delicately delicious house-made green corn tamales, the machacadilla, the savory fajitas, and the more common cheese enchiladas, it is always outstanding.  There is just no comparison.  Thank you, Bugarin Family, for continuing to serve the standard for Mexican food in the Valley!

Very rude service, worst manager ever argueing with the customer, cold nasty sweet shredded beef, disgusting ceilings and air ducts, health code violations all over the place!!! 0000 zero stars not recommended. Horrible.

Love their cheese crisps. Started coming here regularity when Los Compadres started going down hill. Tonight my daughter had a smothered burrito and she loved it. We also ordered flour chips. They are not on the menu and are costly, but soooo worth it.

All I can say is BEST MEXICAN RESTAURANT in Arizona. Service, food and atmosphere are impeccable. We love the queso dip, machacadilla and grilled steak quesadilla.  The Mis Padres margaritas are amazing.  So glad La Pinata's new location still has the family vibe and the same staff and recipes!!  THE BEST!!
The place doesn't even do take out orders!!!! Avoid at all cost if you're hungry looking for food. Fail.

Phoenix should be known for great Mexican food, but most of the places offer the same average stuff.  This one is an exception.  

Service is always great, and the food matches.

The area this place is in seems a bit sketchy sometimes, but the food makes it all worth it.

We loved (and had reviewed) the old location.  The place was a Phoenix tradition.  We were totally bummed to hear they were closing but then excited to hear they would take over the Mary Coyle/Appettitos building.  I was glad to have some competition for Sylvia's.  It us nice they got a regulation replica sign for the place because that is vintage stuff.  They did a really nice job of making use of the space there and I think they might have added some dining space.  I was disappointed that the agave margaritas are gone as are some of the other menu favorites.   Thank goodness they still have the machaca chimichangas because they are AWESOME and always have been.   I miss the kitsch of the old place in its 70's vibe but this is nice.  However, the prices are a little higher.

Back in the 70's Phoenix had a dirth of strip mall Mexican places.  Last Pinata was the busiest of them all with 2 he waits not uncommon.  They are still a great place to go for family run Mexican food.  The machaca is outstanding but I do not believe their story of inventing the chimichanga.  Agave margaritas are good too.

Always enjoy my experience at La Pinata, the service has been outstanding the food always consistent, I started going to the original location over 20 years ago and it just doesn't get any better than this.

We've lived basically down the street from La Pinata since 2003 and had never been. Tonight, that changed everything.

I found myself for the second time today in a restaurant with a penchant for cocks. Roosters, that is. It was crazy, especially when you consider I raised chickens for 4-H growing up. So, I know a thing or two about poultry.

But, enough about that. Back to the restaurant. I really was diging on the interior and all the swanky and low booths and the fowl covered walls.

The food lived up to expectations that we formed from other reviews. The portions are insanely huge. In a way where you want to ask your server, "Do I look like 3 people? How do you think I'll even eat half of this?!?!" But it's all good and some times I like my small stomach because I can relive tonight's experience tomorrow for lunch. Oh, happy day.

I didn't drink any alcohol during dinner (don't worry. I'm feeling fine. Not sick, not coming down with anything, won't be turning down booze, just wasn't in the mood. So quit looking at me like that. I'm drinking right now, if that makes anything better.) and I would have liked to have a lot more water, but our bill was reasonable when one consideres there were 2 margaritas and four beers drunk at the table.

This restaurant used to be in my neighborhood and I loved it. I am so happy for their new location, they are more exposed to more people. 
Their staff is super friendly and the food is delicious.

Today my mom and I had the pleasure of eating here. The food was delicious, the customer service was excellent,  and the prices were reasonable.

I got the red sauce tamale and a beef taco and was pleasantly satisfied by the large portion it came in. Every worker acknowledged me, and smiled. The manager made sure to ask us how everything was, and even asked if we would change anything about our experience. 

Also, their lunch specials were well priced, and the quality of the food is unbelievably good.
Hands down, some of the best Mexican food I've ever had in my life. Jose, the bartender made is feel at home! Olé
